mago: <entryFree id="n27651" type="main" key="Ma_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māgo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Māgon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*ma/gwn</foreign>. <sense id="n27651.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Carthaginian, the brother of Hannibal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 49" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:556" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 556</bibl>; and perhaps also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:564" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 564</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27651.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another Carthaginian, the author of a work on agriculture, which was afterwards translated into Latin by order of the Roman Senate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:58:249" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 58, 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 5, § 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27651.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Hamilcar the elder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 19, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27651.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in the Balearic islands</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Port Mahon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magontiacum: <entryFree id="n27652" type="main" key="Magonti^a^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Magontĭăcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Germany, on the Rhine</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Mayence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl> sq.; called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mogontĭă-cum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 7</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Magontĭăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 8</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maguntia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Venant. Fort. Carm. 9, 9, 1.</sense></entryFree>
magudaris: <entryFree id="n27653" type="greek" key="ma^gu^da^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgŭdăris</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">măgydăris (-dĕris</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">magu/daris</foreign>, <sense id="n27653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the stalk</hi>, acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">the root</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the juice of the plant</hi> laserpitium, Plaut Rud. 3, 2, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 45</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 757</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
magulla: <entryFree id="n27654" type="main" key="Ma_gulla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māgulla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:9:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magulum: <entryFree id="n27655" type="main" key="magu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the jaw, mouth</hi>: conspurcatum, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 16</bibl>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">gna/qos, to\ ma:goulon</foreign>, Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
maguntia: <entryFree id="n27656" type="main" key="Maguntia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maguntia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Magontiacum.</entryFree>
magus: <entryFree id="n27657" type="hapax" key="ma^gus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">măga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/gos</foreign>. <sense id="n27657.0" n="I" level="1"> In the <hi rend="ital">masc., a Magian, a learned man and magician</hi> among the Persians: <cit><quote lang="la">ei magos dixisse, quod genus sapientum et doctorum habebatur in Persis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 41, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:16:43 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 16, 43 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augur, schoenobates, medicus, magus, omnia novit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:77" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 77</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">App. d. Dog. 1, 3, p. 186: nam si (quod ego apud plurimos lego), Persarum linguā magus est, qui nostrā sacerdos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:Mag. 25, p. 290:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. 25, p. 290, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27657.1" n="II" level="1"> In the <hi rend="ital">fem., a female magician, enchantress</hi>: cantusque artesque magarum, v. l. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 195</bibl> (al. <cb n="MAJE" /> leg. magorum): Circe maga famosissima, Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 17.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27658" type="main" key="ma^gus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. magus</etym>, <sense id="n27658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">magic, magical</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus, id. Med. fac. 36: carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 467" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 467</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magydaris: <entryFree id="n27659" type="main" key="ma^gy^da^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgydăris</orth>, v. magudaris.</entryFree>
maharbal: <entryFree id="n27660" type="main" key="Maharbal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maharbal</orth>, <itype>ălis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Carthaginian officer under Hannibal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes">45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 6</bibl>; 46; 51.</sense></entryFree>
maia: <entryFree id="n27661" type="greek" key="maia1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mai=a</foreign>, <sense id="n27661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large kind of crab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 97</bibl>; al. maea.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27662" type="main" key="Ma_ia2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māia</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Māja</orth> (written by Cicero <orth extent="full" lang="la">Majja</orth>, <itype>like ejjus, pejjus</itype>, etc.; <sense id="n27662.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">J</ref></xr>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mai=a</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n27662.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Atlas and Pleione, and the mother of Mercury by Jupiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Majā genitum demittit ab alto,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Mercury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maiā natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 303</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12, 19</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Majam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:174" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 174</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">one of the Pleiades</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctissima Maja,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=270" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi ante occasum Majae coepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 225</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:174" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 174</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27662.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Faunus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maius: <entryFree id="n27663" type="main" key="Ma_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Maia</etym>, usually mensis Maius, <sense id="n27663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the month of May</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cincius mensem (Maium nominatum putat a Maia, quam Vulcani dicit uxorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mensis) tertius a majoribus Maius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:4:34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 4, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 39, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:490" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 490</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also simply Maius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:185" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 185</bibl></cit>.—As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Kalendae Maiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:947" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 947</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idus Maiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 5, 36.</sense></entryFree>
majalis: <entryFree id="n27664" type="main" key="ma_ja_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mājālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gelded boar, a barrow hog</hi> (ante - class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:7:15" default="NO">2, 7, 15</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an unmanned person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc tecum obsecro, ut mihi subvenias, ego ne majalis fuam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Titin.</author> Non. 111, 11</bibl></cit> (Com. Rel. v. 33 Rib.).—As a term of reproach: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc majali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 19</bibl></cit> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 39</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
majesta: <entryFree id="n27665" type="main" key="Ma_jesta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mājesta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of Vulcan</hi>, Piso ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
majestas: <entryFree id="n27666" type="main" key="ma_jestas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mājestas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>major, magnus, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n27666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatness, grandeur, dignity, majesty</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27666.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of the gods; also the condition of men in high station, as kings, consuls, senators, knights, etc., and, in republican states, esp. freq. of the people (class.). </sense><sense id="n27666.2" n="1" level="3"> Of the gods: <cit><quote lang="la">di non censent esse suae majestatis, praesignificare hominibus, quae sunt futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:38:82 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 38, 82 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus est deorum cultus deos credere, deinde reddere illis majestatem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:50" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinam majestatem asserere sibi coepit,</quote> <trans><tr>divine majesty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27666.3" n="2" level="3"> Of men: <cit><quote lang="la">consulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patria,</quote> <trans><tr>the paternal authority</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter nos sanctissima divitiarum majestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:113" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 113</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">The sovereign power, sovereignty of the Roman people</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatem populi Romani defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per majestatem populi Romani subvenite misero mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 25</bibl></cit>: ad tantam magnitudinem Romana majestas cunctorum numinum favore pervenit, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 6, 4, 6: majestatem minuere or laedere, <hi rend="ital">to injure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">offend against the majesty, sovereignty of the people</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatem minuere est de dignitate, aut amplitudine, aut potestate populi, aut eorum, quibus populus potestatem dedit, aliquid derogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:17:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 17, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi Romani majestatem laedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:25:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 25, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21, 12, 19 al.</bibl>: crimen majestatis, <hi rend="ital">high-treason; an offence against the majesty, sovereignty of the people</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et crimen majestatis, quod imperii nostri gloriae, rerumque gestarum monumenta evertere atque asportare ausus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:41:section=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 41, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem sollicitare, res est, quae lege majestatis tenetur,</quote> <trans><tr>against treason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 35, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condemnatus majestatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laesae majestatis accusari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatis causā damnatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:24:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatis judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lege Julia majestatis tenetur is, cujus ope, consilio adversus imperatorem vel rem publicam arma mota sunt, exercitusve ejus in insidias deductus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 29, 1</bibl></cit>.—As a title of honor of the Roman emperors, <hi rend="ital">majesty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 19:16" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 19, 16</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n27666.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">honor, dignity, excellence</hi>, <pb n="1102" /> <cb n="MALA" /> <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestas et pudor matronarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex apum nullum habeat aculeum, majestate solā armatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 17, 17, § 52</bibl></cit>: boum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">fine condition, appearance</hi>, Varr R. R. 2, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa dierum Festorum herboso colitur si quando theatro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:173" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyria majestas,</quote> <trans><tr>the splendor of Tyrian purple</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta illi fuit gravitas! quanta in oratione majestas!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci, i. e. Jovis templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
major: <entryFree id="n27667" type="main" key="ma_jor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mājor</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mājōres</orth>, v. magnus.</entryFree>
majoriarius: <entryFree id="n27668" type="gloss" key="ma_jo_ri^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mājōrĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>major</etym>, <sense id="n27668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great farmer of the revenue</hi> (opp. minuscularius, a petty farmer of the revenue), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1532</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
majorinus: <entryFree id="n27669" type="main" key="ma_jo_ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mājōrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the larger sort, of a larger form</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>: pecunia, Cod. Th. 9, 23, 2.</sense></entryFree>
majugena: <entryFree id="n27670" type="main" key="Ma_ju^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mājŭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Maia-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n27670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Maia-born</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Mercury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
majuma: <entryFree id="n27671" type="main" key="ma_ju_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mājūma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Maius</etym>, <sense id="n27671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great popular festival on the Tiber in the month of May, a kind of mock sea-fight</hi>, Cod. Th. 5, 6, 1; 5, 6, 2.</sense></entryFree>
majus: <entryFree id="n27672" type="main" key="ma_jus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mājus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root mag, whence magis, magnus</etym>, an old word for magnus, <sense id="n27672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">great</hi>, e. g. Majus Deus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Jupiter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dea Maia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
majusculus: <entryFree id="n27673" type="main" key="ma_juscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mājuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n27673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [major], <hi rend="ital">somewhat greater</hi> or <hi rend="ital">larger; somewhat great</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">folia sunt majuscula, quam hederae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 6, 16, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of age, <hi rend="ital">somewhat older</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc vicinam dico lenonis hujus meretricem majusculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thaïs, quam ego sum, majuscula est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mala: <entryFree id="n27674" type="main" key="ma_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mando, like scala, from scando</etym>, <sense id="n27674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cheek-bone, jaw;</hi> in the stricter anatomical sense, the upper bones of the face, between the eyes, nose, and mouth, in which the teeth are fixed (usually in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">maxilla est mobile os. Malae cum toto osse, quod superiores dentes excipit, immobiles sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium pars maxillae, pars superiori ossi malarum haeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: ut meos malis miser manderem natos, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:58:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 58, 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 638</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambesas subigat malis absumere mensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 257</bibl></cit>.—Of the dog, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 755</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the horse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 268</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the wolf,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 681</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the lion: horribilique malā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27674.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, the corresponding external part of the face, <hi rend="ital">a cheek</hi> (mostly in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">infra oculos malae homini tantum, quas prisci genas vocabant Pudoris haec sedes: ibi maxime ostenditur rubor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 58, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugno malam si tibi percussero mox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">feri malam illi rursum,</quote> <trans><tr>slap his cheek again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(juventas) molli vestit lanugine malas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:889" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 889</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 324</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impubes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 751</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenerae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quod Aulo Agerio a Numerio Negidio pugno mala percussa est, Vet. Form. in Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 2, 7, 4: paucae sine vulnere malae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malabathron: <entryFree id="n27675" type="main" key="ma_la^ba^thron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālăbăthron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. malobathron.</entryFree>
malaca: <entryFree id="n27676" type="main" key="Mala^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Malăca</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cha</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*ma/laka</foreign>, <sense id="n27676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of</hi> Hispania Baetica, now <hi rend="ital">Malaga</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 1, 3, § 8</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 64, 3.</sense></entryFree>
malacha: <entryFree id="n27677" type="main" key="malacha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">malacha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. maldacon.</entryFree>
malache: <entryFree id="n27678" type="greek" key="ma^la^che_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălăchē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlŏchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mala/xh</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">molo/xh</foreign>, <sense id="n27678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of mallows</hi> (v. malva). </sense><sense id="n27678.1" n="1" level="3"> Form malache, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:21:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 21, § 103</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 222</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27678.2" n="2" level="3"> Form moloche, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:247" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 247</bibl> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 4, 14, § 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malacia: <entryFree id="n27679" type="greek" key="ma^la^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălăcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">malaki/a</foreign>, <sense id="n27679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calm at sea, dead calm</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27679.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta subito malacia ac tranquillitas exstitit, ut se loco movere non possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27679.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in otio inconcusso jacere non est tranquillitas, malacia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 67:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 67, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27679.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a total want of appetite, nausea</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">semen citreorum edendum praecipiunt in malacia praegnantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 56, § 105</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 6, 57, § 107</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">stomachi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absinthium pellit malaciam stomachi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 28, § 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malacisso: <entryFree id="n27680" type="greek" key="ma^la^cisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălăcisso</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n27680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v a.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">malaki/zw</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="MALE" /> <hi rend="ital">render soft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">supple, to soften, make pliable</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">malacissandus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: articulos, v. l. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:53" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 53</bibl> dub. (Haase, malaxandos).</sense></entryFree>
malacticus: <entryFree id="n27681" type="greek" key="ma^lacti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălactĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">malaktiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mouifying</hi> (post-class.): virtus, Theod. Prisc. de Diaeta, 15.</sense></entryFree>
malacus: <entryFree id="n27682" type="greek" key="ma^la^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">malako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soft, supple, pliant</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">pallium malacum et calidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27682.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">soft, delicate, luxurious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad saltandum malacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unctiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in malacum modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malaginum: <entryFree id="n27683" type="hapax" key="malagi^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">malagĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plaster made without fire</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 3, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malagma: <entryFree id="n27684" type="greek" key="ma^lagma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălagma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">malagma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 48, 9</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">ma/lagma</foreign>, <sense id="n27684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an emollient, poultice, cataplasm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malagmata contusa abunde mollescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5" default="NO">5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 56, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:153" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13, 95, § 153</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malagmatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 33, § 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malandria: <entryFree id="n27685" type="main" key="ma^landri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălandrĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">mălandria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 34</bibl>), <sense id="n27685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blisters</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pustules on the neck</hi>, esp. in horses, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 42, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 8, 29, § 44</bibl> Jan.</sense></entryFree>
malandriosus: <entryFree id="n27686" type="main" key="ma^landri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălandrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>malandria</etym>, <sense id="n27686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of blisters</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pustules on the neck</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malaxatio: <entryFree id="n27687" type="hapax" key="ma^laxa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălaxātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>malaxo</etym>, a <sense id="n27687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">softening, mollifying</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malaxo: <entryFree id="n27688" type="greek" key="ma^laxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălaxo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mala/ssw</foreign>, <sense id="n27688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to soften, mollify</hi>: malas, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">articulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:49" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 49</bibl></cit>; but v. malacisso.</sense></entryFree>
malchinus: <entryFree id="n27689" type="main" key="Malchi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Malchīnus</orth>, v. Malthinus.</entryFree>
malchio: <entryFree id="n27690" type="main" key="Malchi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Malchīo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:32" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maldacon: <entryFree id="n27691" type="hapax" key="malda^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maldăcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the gum of the tree called</hi> bdellium: <cit><quote lang="la">vicina est Bactriana, in qua bdellium nom inatissimum. Arbor nigra est ... gummi alii brochon appellant, alii malacham, alii maldacon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 9, 19, § 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
male: <entryFree id="n27692" type="main" key="ma^le^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. malus, 2. <sense id="n27692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
malea: <entryFree id="n27693" type="main" key="Ma^le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mălĕa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mălēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mălĕae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 1</bibl> B. and K.), = <foreign lang="greek">*male/a</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*ma/leia</foreign>, <sense id="n27693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory in the Peloponnesus, at the south of Laconia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">C. Malea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 32, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 8, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17</bibl> (4, 18), 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 33</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27693.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mălēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the promontory of Malea, Malean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:6:3" default="NO">3, 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malebarbis: <entryFree id="n27694" type="gloss" key="ma^le^barbis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕbarbis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mălĭbarbis</orth> <etym>malebarba</etym>, <foreign lang="greek">spaniopw/gwn</foreign>, <sense id="n27694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a thin beard</hi>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
maledicax: <entryFree id="n27695" type="main" key="ma^le^di^cax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕdĭcax</orth> (or separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕ dĭ-cax</orth>), <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>male-dicax</etym>, <sense id="n27695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foul-mouthed, abusive, slanderous, reviling</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">maledicax es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 26</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27695.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst., a reviler, slanderer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
maledice: <entryFree id="n27696" type="main" key="ma^le^di^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕdĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. maledicus <sense id="n27696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
maledicens: <entryFree id="n27697" type="main" key="ma^le^di_cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕdīcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. maledico <sense id="n27697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
maledicentia: <entryFree id="n27698" type="main" key="ma^le^di_centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕdīcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>maledico</etym>, <sense id="n27698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an evil-speaking, abuse, scurrilousness</hi> (only in Gellius; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. maledictio, procacitas): ob assiduam maledicentiam, et probra in principes civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:14:2" default="NO">17, 14, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maledico: <entryFree id="n27699" type="main" key="ma^le^di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕdīco</orth> (or separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕ dīco</orth>; <sense id="n27699.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">rarely in reverse order: qui bonis dicunt male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 79</bibl>), xi. <itype>ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [male-dico], <hi rend="ital">to speak ill of, to abuse, revile, slander, asperse;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, or with a <case>dat.</case> (so class.) or <case>acc.</case> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n27699.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud est maledicere, aliud accusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27699.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimo viro maledicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpissime alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petulanter alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:97:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 97, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 4, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignis si maledicitur, maledictum id esse dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 14</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n27699.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me amas, maledic illam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 96</bibl></cit>; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27699.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to curse, utter a curse upon</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">populo huic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:22:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 22, 6 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27699.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕdī-cens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., evil - speaking, foulmouthed,<cb n="MALE" />  abusive, scurrilous</hi> (syn. maledi cus): <cit><quote lang="la">maledicentes homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in maledicentissimā civitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 11, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27699.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕdictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., accursed</hi> (post-class. for exsecrabilis): <cit><quote lang="la">maledicte parricida,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Get. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledictus es inter omnia animantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: omnes incesti, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 6, 7 praef.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕ-dictum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a foul</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abusive word</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27699.7" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">maledicta in aliquem dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitam alicujus conicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledictis figere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicta in aliquem conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod crimen (i. e. majestatis) non solum facto, sed et verbis impiis ac maledictis maxime exacerbatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 29, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27699.8" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a curse, imprecation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in maledictis jam antiquis strigem, convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 95, § 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere maledicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27699.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cursed thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christus factus pro nobis maledictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledictum non erit amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 22, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maledictio: <entryFree id="n27700" type="main" key="ma^le^dicti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕdictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>maledico</etym>, <sense id="n27700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an evil-speaking, reviling, abuse</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">maledictio nihil habet propositi praeter contumeliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 147</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n27700.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the act of cursing, a curse, malediction</hi> (freq. in eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui benedictionem et maledictionem proponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 30, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum pro maledictione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Reg. 16, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 24, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maledictito: <entryFree id="n27701" type="hapax" key="ma^le^dicti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕdictĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to revile</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abuse vehemently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repeatedly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 62</bibl> (also separately, male dictitatur).</sense></entryFree>
maledictor: <entryFree id="n27702" type="gloss" key="ma^le^dictor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕdictor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reviler, slanderer</hi>: maledictores dicebantur ab antiquis, qui nunc maledici, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=152:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 152, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> p. 154</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
maledictum: <entryFree id="n27703" type="main" key="ma^le^dictum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕdictum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. maledico <sense id="n27703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
maledictus: <entryFree id="n27704" type="main" key="ma^le^dictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕdictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. maledico, <sense id="n27704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
maledicus: <entryFree id="n27705" type="main" key="ma^le^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>maledico</etym>, <sense id="n27705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foul-mouthed, abusive, scurrilous, slanderous</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">conviciator maledicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicum esse in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 28, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:9:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mă-lĕdĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a slanderous manner, abusively, scurrilously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledice contumelioseque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 134</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">maledice ac maligne loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 39, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malefaber: <entryFree id="n27706" type="main" key="ma^le^fa^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕ-făber</orth>, <itype>bra, brum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>malefaber</etym>, <sense id="n27706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contriving evil, cunning, crafty, insidious</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">suadelae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 716</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malefacio: <entryFree id="n27707" type="main" key="ma^le^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕfăcĭo</orth> (or separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕ fă-cio</orth>), <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>male-facio</etym>, <sense id="n27707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to do evil, harm, mischief</hi> to any one, <hi rend="ital">to injure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tu verbis solves umquam, quod mi re male feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:26:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 26, 21</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malefacere omnia contra aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 38, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕfactum</orth> (or separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕ factum</orth>; sync., <orth extent="full" lang="la">malfactum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 185</bibl>; v. Ritschl, Opusc. 2, p. 720 sq.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an evil deed, injury</hi>: benefacta male locata malefacta arbitror, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 62</bibl> (Trag. v. 429 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">augere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:36:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 36, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malefactio: <entryFree id="n27708" type="hapax" key="ma^le^facti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕfactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>malefacio, properly, an injuring; hence</etym>, <sense id="n27708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">syncope, fainting, swooning</hi>, Macer. de Herb. Carm. 2, 4.</sense></entryFree>
malefactor: <entryFree id="n27709" type="main" key="ma^le^factor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕfactor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an evildoer, malefactor</hi> (Plautin. and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">malefactorem amitti satiu'st quam relinqui beneficum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>it is better to let a malefactor go unpunished than to be ungrateful towards a benefactor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vindictam malefactorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 14.</sense></entryFree>
malefactum: <entryFree id="n27710" type="main" key="ma^le^factum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕfactum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. malefacio <sense id="n27710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
malefice: <entryFree id="n27711" type="main" key="ma^le^fi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕfĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. maleficus <sense id="n27711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
maleficentia: <entryFree id="n27712" type="main" key="ma^le^fi^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕfĭcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>maleficus</etym>, <sense id="n27712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an evil-doing, ill-conduct</hi> towards any one, <hi rend="ital">mischievousness; harm, injury</hi> (post-Aug.). (tursiones) maxime rostris canicularum <pb n="1103" /> <cb n="MALE" /> maleficentiae assimulati, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 9, 11, § 34</bibl>: neque ex beneficentia dei quicquam boni perveniat ad nos, neque ex maleficentia quicquam mali, Lact. Ira Dei, 1, 1.</sense></entryFree>
maleficium: <entryFree id="n27713" type="main" key="ma^le^fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕfĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>maleficus</etym>, <sense id="n27713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an evil deed, misdeed, wickedness, offence, crime</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27713.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27713.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne conscii sint ipsi malefici suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientia maleficiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committere, admittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to commit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilio multare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:34:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 34, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicia pro maleficiis metuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27713.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n27713.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fraud, deception, adulteration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me maleficio vinceres?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 20</bibl></cit> Speng.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27713.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Enchantment, sorcery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 69</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">231, 28</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">magica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 278, 21</bibl></cit>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:595" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 595</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27713.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">mischief, hurt, harm, injury, wrong</hi> inflicted (acc. to maleficus, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">pro maleficio beneficium reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab injuria et maleficio se prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullo maleficio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novis corrumperent maleficiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maleficii occasione omissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 12 al.</bibl></cit> —Hence, transf. (abstr. pro concr.), <hi rend="ital">a noxious insect, vermin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita non nasci maleficia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 308</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:229" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 59, 84, § 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:133" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 13, 51, § 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maleficus: <entryFree id="n27714" type="main" key="ma^le^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕfĭcus</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĭfĭ-cus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>malefacio</etym>, <sense id="n27714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">evil-doing, nefarious, vicious, wicked, criminal</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27714.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27714.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo natura maleficus, et injustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malefici sceleratique homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:55:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 55, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maleficentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores malefici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malefica vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕ-fĭous</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an evil-doer, criminal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra istoc detrudi maleficos Aequom videlur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27714.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">magical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 33, 6</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">substt</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27714.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕfĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a magician, enchanter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de maleficis et mathematicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magi qui malefici vulgi consuetudine nuncupantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 18, 7</bibl></cit>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:594" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 594</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27714.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕfĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a charm, means of enchantment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semusti cineres aliaque malefica, quis creditur anima numinibus inferis sacrari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n27714.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hurtful, injurious, noxious, mischievous</hi> (only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Christiani, genus hominum superstitionis novae atque maleficae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 25, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestia piscibus malefica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 15, 20, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprae, maleficum frondibus animal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 17, 37, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <trans><tr>inimical, unpropitious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕfĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">mischievously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malefidus: <entryFree id="n27715" type="main" key="ma^le^fi_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕ-fīdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n27715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., unfaithful, faithless</hi>, Boëth. Cons. Phil. 1, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 17. (In class. Lat. always separately, as, capiti male fido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:85" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 85</bibl></cit>.)</sense></entryFree>
malefio: <entryFree id="n27716" type="main" key="ma^le^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕfīo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălfīo</orth>, <itype>fĭĕri</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>malefio</etym>, <sense id="n27716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be injured</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Signif. Diaet. Pass. 89" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Signif. Diaet. Pass. 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malens: <entryFree id="n27717" type="main" key="ma_lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālens</orth>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. malo <sense id="n27717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
malesuadus: <entryFree id="n27718" type="main" key="ma^le^sua_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕsuādus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>male-suadeo</etym>, <sense id="n27718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ill-advising, seductive</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Illa hanc corrumpit mulierem viti malesuada plena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 56</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc. (al. vitilena): <cit><quote lang="la">interpres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 5</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. things; <cit><quote lang="la">of wine: malesuadi pocula succi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 6, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 276</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maletractatio: <entryFree id="n27719" type="main" key="ma^le^tracta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕtractātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>male-tracto</etym>, <sense id="n27719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ill-treatment</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 178</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maleus: <entryFree id="n27720" type="main" key="Ma^le_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mălēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Malea, II.</entryFree>
maleventum: <entryFree id="n27721" type="main" key="Ma^le^ventum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mălĕventum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ancient name of</hi> Beneventum, <hi rend="ital">in the Samnite territory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 27, 14</bibl>; v. Beneventum.</sense></entryFree>
malevolens: <entryFree id="n27722" type="main" key="ma^le^vo^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕvŏlens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mălĭvŏl-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>male-volens</etym>, <sense id="n27722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ill-disposed, disaffected, envious, spiteful, malevolent</hi> (very rare, and in <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi> ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">est miserorum ut malevolentes sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malevolentissimae obtrectationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9</bibl>. 17.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕvŏlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a spiteful person, an enemy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam meo malost quod malevolentes gaudeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(manu) malam rem mittunt malevolentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 49</bibl></cit>. <cb n="MALI" /></sense></entryFree>
malevolentia: <entryFree id="n27723" type="main" key="ma^le^vo^lenti_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕvŏlentīa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mălĭv-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>malevolens</etym>, <sense id="n27723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ill-will, evil disposition</hi> towards any one, <hi rend="ital">dislike, hatred, envy, malevolence</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">malevolentia est voluptas ex malo alterius sine emolumento suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malevolentia in ceteros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtrectatio et malevolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malevolentia et invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinitas non infuscata malevolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 9, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malevolus: <entryFree id="n27724" type="main" key="ma^le^vo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕvŏlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mălĭv-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>male-volo</etym>, <sense id="n27724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ill-disposed</hi> towards any one, <hi rend="ital">disaffected, envious, spiteful, malevolent</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27724.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> with <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> with <case>acc.</case> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si omnibus est malevolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato in me turpiter fuit malevolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27724.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27724.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mă-lĕvŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an ill-disposed person, a foe, an enemy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium malevolorum, iniquorum, invidiosorum animos frangerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:25:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 25, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et invidi et malevoli et lividi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27724.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mălĕvŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female enemy, foe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea inimica et malevola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 181</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĕvŏlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., malevolently</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 68" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 68</bibl>, Serm. 27.</sense></entryFree>
malfactum: <entryFree id="n27725" type="main" key="malfactum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">malfactum</orth>, v. malefactum.</entryFree>
maliacus: <entryFree id="n27726" type="main" key="Ma_li^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mālĭăcus Sĭnus</orth>, <sense id="n27726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gulf south of Thessaly</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Gulf of Zeitouni</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30, 3</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n27726.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mālĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Malian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 40, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27726.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mālĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Malian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lympha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malicordis: <entryFree id="n27727" type="gloss" key="ma^li^cordis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĭcordis</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">ponhroka/rdios</foreign>, <sense id="n27727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">badhearted</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
malicorium: <entryFree id="n27728" type="main" key="ma_li^co^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālĭcŏrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>malum-corium</etym>, <sense id="n27728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the rind of a pomegranate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 57, § 107</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malifer: <entryFree id="n27729" type="hapax" key="ma_li^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>malumfero</etym>, <sense id="n27729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">apple-bearing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Et quos maliferae despectant moenia Abellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 740</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malificus: <entryFree id="n27730" type="main" key="ma^li^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĭfĭcus</orth>, v. maleficus.</entryFree>
malignans: <entryFree id="n27731" type="main" key="ma^lignans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălignans</orth>, <pos>P. a.</pos> of maligno, q. v.</entryFree>
maligne: <entryFree id="n27732" type="main" key="ma^ligne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălignē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. malignus <sense id="n27732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
malignitas: <entryFree id="n27733" type="main" key="ma^ligni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălignĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>malignus</etym>. <sense id="n27733.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">ill-will, spite, malice, envy, malignity</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.).—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">malignitati falsa species libertatis inest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malignitas multo veneno tincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malignitas et livor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 41</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: malignitatum vulnera, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 259.—</sense><sense id="n27733.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Stinginess, niggardliness, meanness</hi> [v. malignus, II.]: <cit><quote lang="la">ita malignitate oneravit omnes mortales mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 46, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 34, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 9, 6</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27733.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">stingy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">niggardly act</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malignitatis auctores quaerendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accensaque ea cupiditas est malignitate patrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 42, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27733.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Barrenness, unfruitfulness;</hi> of the vine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
