maligno: <entryFree id="n27734" type="main" key="ma^ligno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măligno</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălignor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to do</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contrive maliciously, to malign</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n27734.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form maligno: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium super populum tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:83:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 83, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena malignantes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>maliciously ejecting</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27734.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form malignor: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta malignatus est inimicus in sancto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:74:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 74, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in prophetis meis nolite malignari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 105, 15</bibl></cit>; 37, 8 sq.—<pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălignan-tes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the wicked</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:21:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 21, 17 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
malignosus: <entryFree id="n27735" type="gloss" key="ma^ligno_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălignōsus</orth>, <sense id="n27735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., active in mischief</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">kakentrexh/s</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
malignus: <entryFree id="n27736" type="main" key="ma^lignus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălignus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for maligenus, malus, and gen-, root of gigno; cf. the opp. benignus</etym>, <sense id="n27736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of an evil nature</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disposition, ill-disposed, wicked, mischievous, malicious, spiteful, envious, malignant, malign</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.; syn.: invidus, malevolus, parcus). </sense><sense id="n27736.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">maligni caupones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnaque numinibus vota exaudita malignis,</quote> <trans><tr>unkind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:111" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 111</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of inanim. and abstr. things: malignissima capita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 651</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente malignā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:101" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 654</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27736.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n27736.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Stingy, niggardly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malignus, largus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—Of favors, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 84</bibl>: vagae <cb n="MALL" /> ne parce malignus arenae ossibus particulam dare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 23</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in laudandis dictionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27736.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27736.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Barren, unfruitful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra malignior ceteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 179</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27736.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Scanty, insufficient, dim, petty, small, narrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium,</quote> <trans><tr>too narrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:96:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 96, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspecta est parva maligna Unda procul venā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 500</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 167</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălignē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n27736.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">ill-naturedly, spitefully, enviously, malignantly</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">maledice ac maligne loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 39</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malignius habitum esse sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27736.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n27736.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Stingily, grudgingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager maligne plebi divisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famem exstinguere,</quote> <trans><tr>sparingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 9</bibl></cit>: non mihi fuit tam maligne, ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">it has not gone so poorly with me that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispensare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:16:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 209</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicis, malignius tecum egisse naturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 44:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 44, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27736.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Little, scantily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra eorum, quae seruntur, maligne admodum patiens,</quote> <trans><tr>a very little</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:34:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 26, § 112</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maliloquax: <entryFree id="n27737" type="main" key="ma^li^lo^quax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĭlŏquax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>male-loquax</etym>, <sense id="n27737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">evil-speaking, slanderous</hi>: lingua est maliloquax mentis indicium malae, P. Syrus in Mim. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Sent. App. v. 267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sent. App. v. 267</bibl> Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
maliloquium: <entryFree id="n27738" type="main" key="ma^li^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>male-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n27738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an evil-speaking, slander</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maliloquus: <entryFree id="n27739" type="main" key="ma^li^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">evilspeaking, slanderous</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 148, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malinus: <entryFree id="n27740" type="greek" key="ma_li^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mh/linos</foreign>, <sense id="n27740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an apple-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27740.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the color of apples, apple-green</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 26, § 53</bibl> Jan.</sense></entryFree>
malitas: <entryFree id="n27741" type="main" key="ma^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>malus; cf. bonitas</etym>, <sense id="n27741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">evil, harm</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">timor majoris malitatis (al. majoris mali),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">kaki/a</foreign>, malitas, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
malitia: <entryFree id="n27742" type="main" key="ma^li^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>malus</etym>, <sense id="n27742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bad quality, badness</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27742.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">terrae malitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arboris,</quote> <trans><tr>unfruitfulness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27742.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">ill-will, spite, malice</hi> (class.): virtutis contraria est vitiositas: sic enim malo, quam malitiam, appellare eam, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">kaki/an</foreign> appellant: <cit><quote lang="la">nam malitia certi cujusdam vitii nomen est: vitiositas omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim malitia versuta et fallax nocendi ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per summam fraudem et malitiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 18, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 26, 70</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. to virtus: virtute, non malitia, P. Scipioni placuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 22, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">malus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine mala omni malitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">collatio nostrarum malitiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">everriculum malitiarum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27742.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Cunning, artfulness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebris malitia adhibenda est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27742.4" n="C" level="2"> Sometimes in a good sense, like our <hi rend="ital">roguery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 26, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen a malitia non discedis,</quote> <trans><tr>you do not desist from your roguery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malitiose: <entryFree id="n27743" type="main" key="ma^li^ti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĭtĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. malitiosus <sense id="n27743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
malitiositas: <entryFree id="n27744" type="main" key="ma^li^ti^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĭtĭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>malitiosus</etym>, <sense id="n27744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wickedness, knavishness</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
malitiosus: <entryFree id="n27745" type="main" key="ma^li^ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĭtĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>malitia</etym>, <sense id="n27745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of wickedness, wicked, knavish, crafty, malicious</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27745.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malitiosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad M. Caes. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad M. Caes. 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">juris interpretatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27745.2" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">nom. prop.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Silva Malitiosa,</quote> <trans><tr>a forest in the Sabine territory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 30, 9</bibl></cit>; = <foreign lang="greek">u(/lh kakou=rgos</foreign>, Dion. 3, 33. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĭtĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">wickedly, knavishly, perfidiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquam agi dolose, aut malitiose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 132</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem mandatam malitiosius gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 111</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malius: <entryFree id="n27746" type="main" key="Ma_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mālĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Maliacus.</entryFree>
malivolens: <entryFree id="n27747" type="main" key="ma^li^vo^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĭvŏlens</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mălĭvŏlentĭa</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mălĭvŏlus</orth>, v. malevolens, etc.</entryFree>
malleator: <entryFree id="n27748" type="main" key="malle^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mallĕātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>malleo, -āre, obs.; v. malleus</etym>, <sense id="n27748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hammerer, hammer-man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">balucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:57:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 57, 9</bibl></cit>: malleatores monetae<pb n="1104" /> <cb n="MALO" />  Caesaris, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 4, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malleatus: <entryFree id="n27749" type="main" key="malle^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mallĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>malleo, -āre, obs.; v. malleus</etym>, <sense id="n27749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wrought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beaten with a hammer, hammered</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">spartum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:52:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 52, § 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malleolaris: <entryFree id="n27750" type="hapax" key="malle^o^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mallĕŏlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>malleolus</etym>, <sense id="n27750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to vine-shoots</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to young vines</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arbor. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arbor. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malleolus: <entryFree id="n27751" type="main" key="malle^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mallĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>malleus</etym>, <sense id="n27751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small hammer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mallet</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27751.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 4, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba mea sunt quasi malleus conterens petram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:23:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 23, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27751.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27751.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hammershaped slip, a mallet-shoot</hi> for planting: <cit><quote lang="la">malleolus novellus est palmes, innatus prioris anni flagello, cognominatusque a similitudine rei, quod in ea parte, quae deciditur, ex vetere sarmento prominens utrinque, malleoli speciem praebet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:6:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleolos pangere,</quote> <trans><tr>to set in, plant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:14:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serere sulco, vel scrobe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 169</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27751.4" n="B" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a kind of fire-dart</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 4, 14</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=135" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 135</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">malleoli, manipuli spartei pice contecti, qui incensi aut in muros aut in testudines jaciuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 556, 11 sq.</bibl></cit>: partim malleolos, partim fasces sarmentorum incensos supra vallum, etc., Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 556, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleolos et faces ad inflammandam urbem comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 24, 64</bibl>: faces taedamque et malleolos stupae illitos pice parari jubet, Liv 42, 64, 3; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 38, 6, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n27751.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The tongue of a shoe-buckle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleoli ossei vel aerei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 34, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malleus: <entryFree id="n27752" type="main" key="malle^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mallĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hammer, mallet, maul</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27752.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(navis) excussa malleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleorum rostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuparius,</quote> <trans><tr>a swingle-staff</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 17</bibl></cit>.—Of the maul or axe for felling animals to be sacrificed: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora discussit claro cava malleus ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 624</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elato alte malleo, cultrarium mactavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">malleum sapientiorem vidi excusso manubrio,</quote> <trans><tr>the hammer wiser than the handle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27752.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a disease among animals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt species mallei septem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mallius: <entryFree id="n27753" type="main" key="Malli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mallĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. Manlius</etym>, <sense id="n27753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27753.1" n="1" level="3"> Mallius Glaucia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34, 96</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27753.2" n="2" level="3"> Cn. Mallius Maximus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:17:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 17, 36</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mallo: <entryFree id="n27754" type="greek" key="mallo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mallo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mallo/s</foreign>. <sense id="n27754.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The stem</hi> of onions (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mallonem caeparum, id est calamos siccos, unde fasces dependent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27754.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of tumor on the knees</hi> in animals, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 48, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malloea: <entryFree id="n27755" type="main" key="Malloea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Malloea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 41, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 10, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mallon: <entryFree id="n27756" type="main" key="mallon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mallon</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Bœotian name for the plant Nymphæa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 37, § 75</bibl> (al. madon).</sense></entryFree>
mallos: <entryFree id="n27757" type="main" key="Mallos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mallos</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mallo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Cilicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:13:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 227</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n27757.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mallōtes</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mālōtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mallw:ths</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*malw/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Mallus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mallus: <entryFree id="n27758" type="greek" key="mallus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mallo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lock of wool</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malluviae: <entryFree id="n27759" type="main" key="mallu^vi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mallŭvĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>manus - lavo</etym>, <sense id="n27759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">water for washing the hands</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=161" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 161</bibl> Müll.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
malluvium: <entryFree id="n27760" type="gloss" key="malluvi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">malluvĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wash-handbasin</hi>: malluvium dicitur, quo manus lavuntur malluviae quibus manus sunt lautae (i. e. <hi rend="ital">water to wash the hands in</hi>), perinde ut quibus pedes pelluviae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=160" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 160</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
malo: <entryFree id="n27761" type="main" key="ma_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālo</orth>, <itype>mālui, malle</itype> (old forms, mavolo for malo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 25</bibl>: <sense id="n27761.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">mavolunt for malunt, Naev. ap. Fest. s. v. stuprum, p. 317 Müll.: mavoluit for maluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:page=77" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. p. 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mavelim for malim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 29</bibl>; 30; 33: <cb n="MALT" /> mavelis for malis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mavelit for malit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mavellem for mallem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 128</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mavolet for malet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 108</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>magis - volo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to choose rather, to prefer</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27761.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., constr. with <case>acc.</case> of the person or thing, with an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n27761.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> of the person or thing (rare): bonos et senatum malet, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambigua, ancipitia malebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin omnia malit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mallem,</quote> <trans><tr>which I would prefer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:239" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 21, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo, Malo Venusinam quam te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:167" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridenda poëmata malo, quam te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:153" default="NO">14, 153</bibl>.—In late Lat. also with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me aliis omnibus mallet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 73, p. 321, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27761.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi> (usu. class. constr.): seseque ii perire mavolunt ibidem, quam, etc., Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=317" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 317</bibl> Müll.; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 81</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato jam servire quam pugnare mavult,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maluit illum esse deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 57, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium prius de probro quam de re maluit fieri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetextam sumere mavis, an esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:99" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27761.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse quam videri bonus malebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde fit ut malim fraterculus esse gigantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:98" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 98</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27761.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mallem ... cognoscerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mallem divitias mihi dedisses, Quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula sit mavult, quam sine amore deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:32" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo pater tibi sit Thersites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:269" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 269</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes with <hi rend="ital">comp. abl.</hi> instead of <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">nullos his mallem ludos spectasse,</quote> <trans><tr>rather than these</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne dubitaret armis incruentas conditiones malle,</quote> <trans><tr>to choose rather than arms, prefer to arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 46</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes followed pleonastically by <hi rend="ital">potius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab omnibus desertos potius quam abs to defensos esse malunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ille Uticae potius, quam Romae, cum alienis esse quam cum suis maluisset?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; id. Cat. ap. Fam. 15, 5, 2; Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl>, A, 3.—Also by <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui magis vere vincere, quam diu imperare malit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">multo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">haud paulo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo judicio multo stare malo, quam aliorum,</quote> <trans><tr>much rather</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud paulo hunc animum malim quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27761.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to be more favorable to</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac re malo universae Asiae et negotiatoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam illi omnia malo, quam mihi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>would rather he had them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 24, 59</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mālens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., preferring</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 2</bibl>, ad 14, 4; Aug. c. Jul. 4, 14, 68.</sense></entryFree>
malobathratus: <entryFree id="n27762" type="main" key="ma_lo^ba^thra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālŏbăthrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>malobathron</etym>, <sense id="n27762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">anointed with</hi> malobathron (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">satrapae pumicati, malobathrati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malobathrinus: <entryFree id="n27763" type="greek" key="ma_lo^ba_^thri^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālŏbā^thrĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">maloba/qrinos</foreign>, <sense id="n27763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of betel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut 3:3:24" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malobathron: <entryFree id="n27764" type="greek" key="ma_lo^ba^thron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālŏbăthron</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mālŏbăthrum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">malo/baqron</foreign>. <sense id="n27764.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an Indian</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Syrian plant, from which a costly oint ment was prepared</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">betel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">base cin namon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 26, 59, § 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 415</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27764.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the oil procured from this plant, malobathrum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronatus nitentes Malobathro Syrio capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also used in medicine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 48, § 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malogranata: <entryFree id="n27765" type="main" key="ma_lo^gra_na_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālŏgrānāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pomegranatetree</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malogranatum: <entryFree id="n27766" type="main" key="ma_lo^gra_na_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālŏgrānātum</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">mālum grānātum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. malum-granatum</etym>, <sense id="n27766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pomegranate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 31, § 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Com. ad Aggen. 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 20, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malope: <entryFree id="n27767" type="greek" key="ma_lo^pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mallows</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorem (malvam) Graeci malopen vocant in sativis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 222</bibl></cit> (v. malva).</sense></entryFree>
maltha: <entryFree id="n27768" type="greek" key="maltha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maltha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/lqa</foreign>, <sense id="n27768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of thick, fatty petroleum</hi> from Samosata, <hi rend="ital">fossil tar</hi>, the flame of which could be extinguished only with earth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 104, 108, § 235</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27768.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of varnish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cement</hi> made of slaked lime and hog's fat: maltha e calce fit recenti; gleba vino restinguitur:<cb n="MALU" />  mox tunditur cum adipe suillo et ficu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 24, 38, § 181</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 41</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n27768.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an effeminate person</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 37, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malthinus: <entryFree id="n27769" type="main" key="Malthi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Malthīnus</orth> (al. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maltī-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>maltha, II.</etym>, <sense id="n27769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fictitious name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maltho: <entryFree id="n27770" type="main" key="maltho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maltho</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cement, to varnish</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 24, 58, § 181</bibl>, Schol. Juv, 5, 48 Cramer.</sense></entryFree>
maluginensis: <entryFree id="n27771" type="main" key="Malu_gi^nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Malūgĭnensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Cornelia, e. g. M. Cornelius Maluginensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maluginosus: <entryFree id="n27772" type="gloss" key="malugino_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maluginōsus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">makentrexh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cunning, crafty</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
malum: <entryFree id="n27773" type="main" key="ma^lum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. malus, <sense id="n27773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27774" type="greek" key="ma_lum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mh=lon</foreign> (Doric <foreign lang="greek">ma= lon</foreign>), <sense id="n27774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an apple</hi>, i. e. any tree-fruit fleshy on the outside, and having a kernel within (opp. nux); hence, applied also to quinces, pomegranates, peaches, oranges, lemons, etc. </sense><sense id="n27774.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 14, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:127 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 127 al.</bibl>: malis orbiculatis pasci, Cael. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15</bibl>.—In a pun with mălum, <hi rend="ital">a calamity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">91 al.</bibl>—Prov.: ab ovo usque ad mala, i. e. <hi rend="ital">from beginning to end</hi> (from the Roman custom to begin meals with eggs and end with fruit), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 7</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum discordiae,</quote> <trans><tr>an apple of discord</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:15:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 15, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27774.2" n="II" level="1"> Malum terrae, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi> (the Aristolochia), having four varieties, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 54, § 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 202" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 202</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called malum terrenum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
malundrum: <entryFree id="n27775" type="hapax" key="malundrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">malundrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 24, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malus: <entryFree id="n27776" type="main" key="ma^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mălus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. mala, dirt; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">me/las</foreign>, black; cf. macula; Germ. mal in Mutter-mal, etc.</etym>.—<sense id="n27776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: pējor, pejus.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: pessimus, a, um, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>, in the widest sense of the word (opp. bonus), <hi rend="ital">evil, wicked, injurious, destructive, mischievous, hurtful;</hi> of personal appearance, <hi rend="ital">ill-looking, ugly, deformed;</hi> of weight, <hi rend="ital">bad, light;</hi> of fate, <hi rend="ital">evil, unlucky</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">malus et nequam homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pessima puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 36, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:10" default="NO" valid="yes">55, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delituit mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi minime mali illi quidem, sed non satis acuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malam opinionem habere de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:24:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 24, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Furiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 471</bibl></cit>: carmen, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an incantation</hi>, Leg. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi in malam rem,</quote> <trans><tr>go and be hanged!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <trans><tr>unsuccessful, adverse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:25:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 25, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ill-boding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: aetas, <hi rend="ital">burdensome</hi>, i. e. senectus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud mala est mulier,</quote> <trans><tr>not badlooking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>deformed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>light, deficient</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 156</bibl></cit>.—Of the sick: <cit><quote lang="la">in malis aeger est,</quote> <trans><tr>in great danger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus a quo omnis aeger pejor fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo tempore fere pessimi sunt qui aegrotant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. sing.</hi>, as <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne gallina malum responset dura palato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: pejor, <hi rend="ital">worse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 96</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27776.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mă-lum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">any thing bad, an evil, mischief, misfortune, calamity</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n27776.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">orarem, ut ei, quod posses mali facere, faceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam sit bellum, cavere malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil enim mali accidisse Scipioni puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes inopinato malo turbati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">externum, i. e. bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hamilc. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hamilc. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in cotidianam id malum vertat, i. e. febris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc malo domitos potius cultores agrorum fore, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 34, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27776.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n27776.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Punishment; hurt, harm, severity, injury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo domandam tribuniciam potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo exercitum coërcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 100, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 81</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 49, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vi, malo, plagis adductus est, ut frumenti daret,</quote> <trans><tr>ill-usage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:23:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 23, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amanti amoenitas malo est: nobis lucro est,</quote> <trans><tr>is hurtful, injurious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementiam illi malo fuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>was injurious, unfortunate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: malo hercle magno suo convivat sine modo, <hi rend="ital">to his own</hi> <pb n="1105" /> <cb n="MALU" /> <hi rend="ital">hurt</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 474, 23</bibl> (Sat. v. 1 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">olet homo quidam malo suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male merenti bona es: at malo cum tuo,</quote> <trans><tr>to your own hurt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27776.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Wrong-doing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae, quae numquam malo defuturae sunt, Sen. de Ira, 1, 16, 3: sperans famam exstingui veterum sic posse malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 527</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, 178</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27776.6" n="(g)" level="5"> As a term of abuse, <hi rend="ital">plague, mischief, torment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu, malum, me sequere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, malum, alii?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae, malum, est ista tanta audacia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20, § 54</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:41" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27776.7" n="(d)" level="5"> As an exclamation, <hi rend="ital">alas! misery!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 37</bibl> Brix ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n27776.8" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">măle</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., badly, ill, wrongly, wickedly, unfortunately, erroneously, improperly</hi>, etc.: dubitas, quin lubenter tuo ero meus, quod possiet facere, faciat male? <hi rend="ital">will do all the harm to him</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 66</bibl>: si iste Italiam relinquet, faciet omnino male, et, ut ego existimo, <foreign lang="greek">a)logistws</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">will act altogether unwisely</hi>, Attic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di isti Segulio male faciant,</quote> <trans><tr>do harm to him, punish him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o factum male de Alexione!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male velle alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to wish ill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Karthagini male jamdiu cogitanti bellum multo ante denuntio, cogitare de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male loqui alicui, for maledicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male accipere verbis aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatu agmen adversariorum, male habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to harass, annoy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc male habet virum,</quote> <trans><tr>annoys, vexes him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male se habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to feel ill, dejected, low-spirited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male est animo,</quote> <trans><tr>it vexes me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male est animo,</quote> <trans><tr>I feel unwell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male fit animo,</quote> <trans><tr>I am beginning to feel bad, am getting unwell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: L. Antonio male sit, si quidem, etc., <hi rend="ital">evil betide him!</hi> (a formula of imprecation), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res tibi vertat male,</quote> <trans><tr>much harm may it do you!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male tibi esse malo quam molliter,</quote> <trans><tr>I would rather you should be unfortunate than effeminate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium male pugnatum,</quote> <trans><tr>unsuccessfully</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae male empta sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>at a bad bargain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male vendere,</quote> <trans><tr>at a sacrifice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98:section=227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male reprehendunt praemeditationem rerum futurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:16:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male tegere mutationem fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male sustinere arma,</quote> <trans><tr>unskilfully</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 12</bibl></cit>: non dubito, quin me male oderit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">very much, intensely</hi>, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">male metuo, ne, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>exceedingly, much</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rauci,</quote> <trans><tr>miserably</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 66</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">When attached to an adjective, it freq. gives it the opposite meaning: male sanus = insanus,</quote> <trans><tr>insane, deranged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male sana,</quote> <trans><tr>with mind disturbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ungrateful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male fidas provincias,</quote> <trans><tr>unfaithful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statio male fida carinis,</quote> <trans><tr>unsafe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oderam multo pejus hunc quam illum ipsum Clodium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pejusque leto flagitium timet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 50</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cane pejus vitabit chlamydem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27777" type="greek" key="ma_lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mhle/a</foreign>, <sense id="n27777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appletree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus bifera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et steriles platani malos gessere valentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus granata,</quote> <trans><tr>the pomegranate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felices arbores putantur esse quercus...malus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27778" type="main" key="ma_lus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mālus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>by some referred to root mac-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">makros</foreign>; Lat. magnus; but perh. the same word with 2. malus</etym>, <sense id="n27778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an upright mast, pole</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">beam</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27778.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">malos exaequantes altitudinem jugi surrexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:8:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27778.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n27778.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mast</hi> of a ship: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si qui gubernatorem in navigando agere nihil dicant, cum alii malos scandant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum erigi, vela fieri imperavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attolli malos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:829" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 829</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo suspendit ab alto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 489</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saucius,</quote> <trans><tr>injured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27778.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A standard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pole</hi>, to which the awnings spread over the theatre were attached, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 7, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27778.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The beam</hi> in the middle of a wine-press, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 317</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27778.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The corner beams</hi> of a tower: <cit><quote lang="la">turrium mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22, 4</bibl></cit>. <cb n="MAMM" /></sense></entryFree>
malva: <entryFree id="n27779" type="main" key="malva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">malva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">mala/xh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n27779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mallows</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in magnis laudibus malva est utraque, et sativa, et silvestris. Duo genera earum amplitudine folii discernuntur: majorem Graeci malopen vocant in sativis. Alteram ab emoliendo ventre dictam putant malachen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 222</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
malvaceus: <entryFree id="n27780" type="main" key="malva_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">malvācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>malva</etym>, <sense id="n27780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to mallows, like mallows, mallowshaped</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">caulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mamercinus: <entryFree id="n27781" type="main" key="Ma_merci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māmercīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Mamercus, Mamercine</hi>, a Roman surname, e. g. L. Aemilius Mamercinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mamercus: <entryFree id="n27782" type="main" key="Ma_mercus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māmercus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Mamers for Mars</etym>, <sense id="n27782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Oscan prænomen</hi>: Mamercus praenomen Oscum est, ab eo, quod hi Martem Mamertem appellant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=130" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 130</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n27782.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname in the Æmilian</hi> gens, <hi rend="ital">who claimed Numa as their ancestor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridere Mamercorum alapas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:192" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 192</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Aemilius Mamercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:175" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 47, 175</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mamers: <entryFree id="n27783" type="main" key="Ma_mers"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māmers</orth>, <itype>mertis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Oscan name for Mars</hi>: Mamers Mamertis facit, id est lingua Osca Mars Martis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=131" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 131</bibl> Müll.; cf. id. s. v. Mamertini, p. 158 ib. The Sabines also gave to Mars the name of Mamers, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=73" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 73</bibl> Müll. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n27783.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Māmertīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Mamertines</hi>.—After the death of Agathocles of Syracuse, B. C. 289, the mercenary troops which he had collected from Umbria seized the city of Messana in Sicily, murdered the inhabitants, and made themselves masters of the vicinity. They called themselves <hi rend="ital">Mamertines</hi>, from Mamers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:5:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 5, § 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:23:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 23, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 28, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27783.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Māmertīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Mamertines, Mamertine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:5:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 6, § 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 10, § 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:117" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mamertinus: <entryFree id="n27784" type="main" key="Ma_merti_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māmertīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Claudius M., <sense id="n27784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consul</hi>, A. D. 362, <hi rend="ital">under Julian, to whom he wrote a letter, which is still extant, thanking him for his promotion to this dignity</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n27785" type="main" key="Ma_merti_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māmertīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Mamers.</entryFree>
mamilius: <entryFree id="n27786" type="main" key="Ma^mili^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mămilĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype> <etym>root mar-, the shining, splendid one; cf. marmor</etym>, <sense id="n27786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n27786.1" n="1" level="3"> Octavius Mamilius, <hi rend="ital">a prince of Tusculum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27786.2" n="2" level="3"> C. Mamilius Limetanus, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 40, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27786.3" n="3" level="3"> C. Mamilius Vitulus, <hi rend="ital">a prætor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:50:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 50, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27786.4" n="4" level="3"> L.
