Mamilius Tusculanus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 29</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27786.5" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mămilĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Mamilius, Mamilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogatio,</quote> <trans><tr>of the tribune Mamilius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 33, 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 40, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 65:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 65, 5</bibl>: turris, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=131" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 131</bibl>; v. Müll. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
mamilla: <entryFree id="n27787" type="main" key="ma^milla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mămilla</orth> (incorrectly <orth extent="full" lang="la">mamm-</orth>; cf. Lachm. ad Lucr. vol. 2, p. 36), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mamma</etym>, <sense id="n27787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breast, pap, nipple, teat</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27787.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:70:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 70, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:400" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 400</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeva in parte mamillae Nil salit juveni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrofa triginta clara mamillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:163" default="NO">13, 163</bibl>.—As a term of endearment, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27787.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a little pipe</hi> joined to a larger one, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mamillanus: <entryFree id="n27788" type="hapax" key="ma^milla_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mămillānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mamilla, having breasts; hence, transf.</etym>, <sense id="n27788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full, swelling, protuberant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mamillare: <entryFree id="n27789" type="main" key="ma^milla_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mămillāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breast-cloth, stomacher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:66" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 66</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
mamillaris: <entryFree id="n27790" type="main" key="ma^milla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mămillāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n27790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the breast</hi>: tumores, Dyn. 2, 96.</sense></entryFree>
mamma: <entryFree id="n27791" type="main" key="mamma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mamma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma:mma</foreign>, <sense id="n27791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breast, pap</hi>, esp. of females, rarely of males; also, <hi rend="ital">a teat, dug</hi> of animals. </sense><sense id="n27791.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puero isti date mammam,</quote> <trans><tr>give him the breast, suckle him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer in gremio matris sedens, mammam appetens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera mammarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:885" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 885</bibl></cit>.—Of a man: <cit><quote lang="la">mammas homo solus e maribus habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 95, § 232</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mammam sugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mammas praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 40, 95, § 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mamma sterilescit,</quote> <trans><tr>dries up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n27791.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27791.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A protuberance</hi> on <cb n="MANA" /> the bark of a tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 16, 26, § 118</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n27791.4" n="B" level="2"> In the language of children, <hi rend="ital">mother, mamma</hi>: cum cibum ac potionem buas ac papas vocent, matrem mammam, patrem tatam, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 81, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:101:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 101, 1</bibl>. —In inscrr., for <hi rend="ital">mother</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2769</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2813</bibl>; for <hi rend="ital">grandmother</hi>, Inscr. Mur. 1134, 3; for <hi rend="ital">nurse</hi>, Inscr. Visc. Mus. Pio-Clem. t. 2, p. 82.</sense></entryFree>
mammaea: <entryFree id="n27792" type="main" key="Mammaea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mammaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mother of the emperor Alexander Severus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 3, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27792.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mammaeānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mammæa, Mammæan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 57, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mammalis: <entryFree id="n27793" type="main" key="mamma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mammālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mamma</etym>, <sense id="n27793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for the breasts</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans><tr>good for diseases of the breasts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mammatus: <entryFree id="n27794" type="main" key="mamma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mammātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mamma, having breasts; hence, transf.</etym>, <sense id="n27794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with little pipes</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 159</bibl>, v. Sillig. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
mammeatus: <entryFree id="n27795" type="hapax" key="mamme^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mammĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, for mammosus, <sense id="n27795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having large breasts, largebreasted, full-breasted</hi> (Plautin.): amica <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Poen. 1:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 181</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 137, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mammicula: <entryFree id="n27796" type="main" key="mammi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mammĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little breast</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a man's breast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi mamma mammicula opprimitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mammilla: <entryFree id="n27797" type="main" key="mammilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mammilla</orth>, v. mamilla.</entryFree>
mammo: <entryFree id="n27798" type="main" key="mammo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mammo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>mamma</etym>, <sense id="n27798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give suck</hi> (late Lat.): vae tunc praegnantibus et mammantibus, S. S. Marc. 13, 17, ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 95:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 95, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mammonas: <entryFree id="n27799" type="greek" key="mammo_nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mammōnas</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mammōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mammon</orth>, <itype>nos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mammwna=s</foreign> [properly, Syr. <foreign />], <sense id="n27799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">riches, mammon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potestis servire Deo et Mammonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 6, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Domin. 2:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Domin. 2, 14</bibl>: mammona iniquitatis prodere, Aug. Civ. Dei, 1, 10, 3.</sense></entryFree>
mammoneus: <entryFree id="n27800" type="main" key="mammo_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mammōnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mammonas</etym>, <sense id="n27800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greedy of gain, self-interested</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 429</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mammosus: <entryFree id="n27801" type="main" key="mammo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mammōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mamma</etym>, <sense id="n27801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having large breasts, full-breasted</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27801.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: non mammosa, non annosa, non<*> bibosa, Laber. ap.  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 12</bibl>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">canes feminae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27801.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full, protuberant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus panici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 54</bibl></cit>: tus, <hi rend="ital">cluster-shaped</hi>, in which one drop adheres to the other, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mammothreptus: <entryFree id="n27802" type="greek" key="mammothreptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mammothreptus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mammo/qreptos</foreign>, <sense id="n27802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nourished by a nurse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. Conc. 30" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. Conc. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mammula: <entryFree id="n27803" type="main" key="mammu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mammŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mamma</etym>, <sense id="n27803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little breast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">teat</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27803.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27803.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in the language of children, <hi rend="ital">little mamma, mammy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4849</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4671</bibl>; cf. mamma, II. B.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27804" type="main" key="Mammu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mammŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Cornelius Mammula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mamphula: <entryFree id="n27805" type="foreign" key="mamphu_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mamphūla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of Syrian bread</hi>: mamphula appellatur panis Syriaci genus, quod, ut ait Venius, in clibano, antequam percoquatur, decidit in carbones cineremque, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=142" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 142</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
mamphur: <entryFree id="n27806" type="gloss" key="mamphur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mamphur</orth>, <itype>appellatur loro circumvolutum mediocris longitudinis lignum rotundum, quod circumagunt fabri in operibus tornandis</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=132" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 132</bibl> Müll., <sense id="n27806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bow-drill</hi> [acc. to Scalig. mutilated from <foreign lang="greek">mannofo/ron</foreign>, wearing a collar].</sense></entryFree>
mamurius: <entryFree id="n27807" type="main" key="Ma_mu_^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māmū^rĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, in full, Mamurius Veturius, <sense id="n27807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the maker of the</hi> ancilia; v. ancile, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=131" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 131</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:391" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 2, 61 (where Müll. Mamurri).—Varro explains in an entirely different manner the expression, Mamuri Veturi, which he considers an appellative, signifying memoriam veterem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 45</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
mamurra: <entryFree id="n27808" type="main" key="Ma_murra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māmurra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman knight of Formiæ</hi>, praefectus fabrūm <hi rend="ital">in Gaul under Cæsar, who was the first in Rome to cover the walls of his house on the Mons Cœlius with marble, and had none but marble columns in his house</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 7, § 48</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 52, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mamurrarum urbs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Formiæ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mana: <entryFree id="n27809" type="main" key="Ma_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Māna</orth>, <itype>also Genita Mana</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ma-nuāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ancient Roman goddesses</hi> <pb n="1106" /> <cb n="MANC" /> <hi rend="ital">who presided over the submanes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 14, § 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n27810" type="main" key="mana2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mana</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, false read. for manos.</entryFree>
manabilis: <entryFree id="n27811" type="hapax" key="ma_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mānābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mano</etym>, <sense id="n27811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing, running;</hi> hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">penetrating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 534</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manachus: <entryFree id="n27812" type="greek" key="ma_na^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mānăchus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mānăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mh/naxos</foreign>, Dor. <foreign lang="greek">ma/naxos</foreign>, <sense id="n27812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ecliptic</hi> on a sundial, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8</bibl> (Schneid. reads menaeus).</sense></entryFree>
manalis: <entryFree id="n27813" type="main" key="ma_na_lis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mānālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mano</etym>, <sense id="n27813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing</hi> (ante-class.): manalem fontem dici pro eo, quod aqua ex eo semper manet, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=128" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 128</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 157</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">manalem vocabant lapidem etiam (cf. another signif. in the foll. art.) petram quandam, quae erat extra portam Capenam juxta aedem Martis, quam cum propter nimiam siccitatem in Urbem protraherent, insequebatur pluvia statim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 128</bibl></cit> ib.; cf.: manalis lapis, qui tunc movetur, cum pluviae exoptantur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 547, 10</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Expos. Serm. p. 559, 16 sq.</bibl>—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mānāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a ewer</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 547, 9</bibl>; cf. aquaemanalis.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27814" type="main" key="Ma_na_lis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mānālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Manes</etym>, <sense id="n27814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Manes</hi>: Manalem lapidem putabant esse ostium Orci, per quod animae inferorum ad superos manarent, qui dicuntur manes, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=128:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 128, 14</bibl> Müll. (perhaps from the same origin as the preceding word).</sense></entryFree>
manamen: <entryFree id="n27815" type="hapax" key="ma_na_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mānāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mano</etym>, <sense id="n27815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bivio refluus manamine pontus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in ebb and flood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mosell. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manatio: <entryFree id="n27816" type="main" key="ma_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mānātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing, flowing out</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 65" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:110" default="NO">110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:122" default="NO">122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manceps: <entryFree id="n27817" type="main" key="manceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">manceps</orth>, <itype>ĭpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>manus-capio</etym>, <sense id="n27817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purchaser</hi> of any thing at a public auction, <hi rend="ital">a renter, farmer, contractor</hi>, etc. (syn.: redemtor, exactor). </sense><sense id="n27817.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: manceps dicitur, qui quid a populo emit conducitve, quia manu sublata significat se auctorem emptionis esse: qui idem praes dicitur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=151" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 151</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">postremo ne in praedae quidem societate mancipem aut praedem ... reperire potuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si res abiret ab eo mancipe, quem ipse apposuisset,</quote> <trans><tr>contractor for building</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis studiosissimi nobilitatis manceps fit Chrysogonus,</quote> <trans><tr>the purchaser</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipes a civitatibus pro frumento pecuniam exegerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>the contractors with the government, farmers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 10, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 10, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius rei neque praes neque manceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis praevalens annonam flagellet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a forestaller, speculator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 13, 57, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sutrinae,</quote> <trans><tr>a keeper of a stall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 43, 60, § 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">operarum,</quote> <trans><tr>one who hires laborers to let them out again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">itinera fraude mancipum et incuria magistratuum interrupta,</quote> <trans><tr>a farmer of the revenue, farmer-general</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">VIAE APPIAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3221</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27817.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27817.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A surety, bondsman, bail</hi>, = praes: <cit><quote lang="la">ego mancipem te nihil moror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 29</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n27817.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One who hires people to applaud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conducti et redempti mancipes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n27817.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The owner, proprietor</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">possessor</hi> of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">deus et manceps divinitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27817.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A master, chief</hi>: carceris, i. e. <hi rend="ital">jailer</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 345; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Spect. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mancia: <entryFree id="n27818" type="main" key="Manci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mancĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. Q. Mucius Mancia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mancinus: <entryFree id="n27819" type="main" key="Manci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mancīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, e. g. C. Hostilius Mancinus, <hi rend="ital">a consul who was delivered up to the Numantines, on the refusal of the Roman people to ratify the dishonorable treaty of peace which he had made with them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:18:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 18, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 181</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 56, 238</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 32, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 30, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:34:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 34, 98</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=131" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 131</bibl> Müll.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27819.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mancī-nĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mancinus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the delivering up of Mancinus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:14:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manciola: <entryFree id="n27820" type="main" key="manci^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mancĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>manus</etym>, <sense id="n27820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little hand</hi> (ante-class.), Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manciparius: <entryFree id="n27821" type="main" key="manci^pa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mancĭpārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = mango, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:148" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 148</bibl>.</entryFree>
mancipatio: <entryFree id="n27822" type="main" key="manci^pa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mancĭpātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mancŭp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mancipo</etym>, <sense id="n27822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making over, delivery, transfer</hi> of a thing to another; one of the <cb n="MANC" /> modes of acquiring possession by the Roman civil law; hence, also, for <hi rend="ital">purchase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mancipio accipit, apprehendere id ipsum, quod ei mancipio datur, necesse sit: unde etiam mancipatio dicitur, quia manu res capitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:121" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 121</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in full under mancipium): <cit><quote lang="la">mancupationem tabulis probare,</quote> <trans><tr>the purchase</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mancipatus: <entryFree id="n27823" type="main" key="manci^pa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mancĭpātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mancipo</etym>. <sense id="n27823.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sale</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in mancipatum venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 60, § 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27823.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">business of a public farmer</hi> (in jurid. Lat.), Cod. Th. 8, 5, 36; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mancipi: <entryFree id="n27824" type="main" key="manci^pi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mancĭpi</orth>, v. mancipium <sense id="n27824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mancipium: <entryFree id="n27825" type="main" key="manci^pi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mancĭpĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mancŭpĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype> (the contr. form of the <sense id="n27825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, mancipi, like imperi, ingeni, etc., predominates in jurid. lang.), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>manceps</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a taking by hand;</hi> hence, law t. t., <hi rend="ital">the formal acceptance, the taking possession of a purchase and sale</hi> (corresponding to the formal delivery by the vendor; cf. the feudal livery of seisin, etc.); <hi rend="ital">the legal, formal purchase</hi> of a thing: est autem mancipatio imaginaria quaedam venditio: quod et ipsum jus proprium civium Romanorum est. Eaque res ita agitur: adhibitis non minus quam quinque testibus civibus Romanis puberibus et praeterea alio ejusdem condicionis, qui libram aeneam teneat, qui appellatur libripens, is qui mancipio accipit, rem tenens ita dicit: hunc ego hominem ex jure Quiritium meum esse aio, isque mihi emptus est hoc aere aëneaque libra: deinde aere percutit libram, idque aes dat ei, a quo mancipio accipit, quasi pretii loco. Eo modo et serviles et liberae personae mancipantur: animalia quoque, quae mancipi sunt, quo in numero habentur boves, equi, muli, asini; <cit><quote lang="la">ita praedia tam urbana quam rustica, quae et ipsa mancipi sunt, qualia sunt Italica, eodem modo solent mancipari. In eo solo praediorum mancipatio a ceterorum mancipatione differt, quod personae serviles et liberae, item animalia quae mancipi sunt, nisi in praesentia sint, mancipari non possunt, adeo quidem, ut eum, qui mancipio accipit, apprehendere id ipsum, quod ei mancipio datur, necesse sit: unde etiam mancipatio dicitur, quia manu res capitur: praedia vero absentia solent mancipari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:119 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 119 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc in mancipio Marius non dixerat,</quote> <trans><tr>at the sale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 16, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum M. Marius Graditianus aedes Auratae vendidisset, neque in mancipii lege dixisset, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>in the contract of sale ... in the sale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 178</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27825.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27825.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A possession, property, right of ownership</hi>, acquired by such purchase: mancipio dare, and accipere, <hi rend="ital">to give</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take possession of</hi> by way of formal seizure (on the case of mancipio, v. Roby, Gram. 2, § 1243): <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Memini et mancipio tibi dabo. <hi rend="ital">Cu.</hi> Egon' ab lenone quicquam Mancipio accipiam? quibus sui nihil est nisi una lingua? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 50, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille aedis mancupio aps te accepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egomet ei me mancupio dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finge mancipio aliquem dedisse id, quod mancipio dari non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:10:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 10, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in mancipio alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to be the property of any one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:6:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancupio aedis poscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 42</bibl></cit>.— Esp., in the Roman law, things were classified as res mancipi (for mancipii; also, <cit><quote lang="la">res mancupi for mancupii) and res nec mancipi, i. e. things transferrible only by formal mancipation, and things transferrible by mere delivery,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:15" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 15</bibl></cit> sqq.; 59; 65; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 19, 1</bibl> sqq. (cf. Maine, Ancient Law, chap. viii.): <cit><quote lang="la">in iis rebus repetendis, quae mancipi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abalienatio est ejus rei, quae mancipi est, aut traditio alteri nexu aut in jure cessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27825.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitaque mancipio nulli datur, omnibus usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:971" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 971</bibl></cit>: fortuna nihil dat mancipio, <hi rend="ital">bestows nothing as a property</hi> or <hi rend="ital">constant possession</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 72:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 72, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27825.4" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a slave obtained by</hi> mancipium: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipia, quae dominorum sunt facta nexu aut aliquo jure civili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27825.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a slave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Edepol mancipium scelestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipiis locuples eget aeris Cappadocum rex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipia argento parata,</quote> <trans><tr>purchased slaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cb n="MAND" /> mancipium Caesaris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudum olido stans Fornice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:172" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 172</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:120" default="NO">9, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 18, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27825.6" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">jurat, Se fore mancipium tempus in omne tuum,</quote> <trans><tr>thy slave, servant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:5:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis Musae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 476</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mancipo: <entryFree id="n27826" type="main" key="manci^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mancĭpo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mancŭpo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>manceps</etym>. <sense id="n27826.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deliver up as property</hi> by means of the formal act of purchase (mancipium; v. mancipium <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to dispose of, transfer, alienate, sell</hi> (not in Cic.; for the true reading ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 24</bibl>, is emancipaverat; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 38</bibl>, emancipatus; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 21, 51</bibl>, emancipatum). </sense><sense id="n27826.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienos mancupatis, Alienos manumittitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos singulos actori publico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:33" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defundo mancipando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 4:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam, si credis consultis, mancipat usus,</quote> <trans><tr>gives one a title to, makes one's property</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 159</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27826.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to give up to, deliver up, subject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxu et saginae mancipatus emptusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus mero et stupro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 223, 29</bibl></cit>: de ignaviae latebris retractus curiarum functionibus mancipetur, Cod. Th. 12, 1, 83.—*</sense><sense id="n27826.3" n="II" level="1"> I. q. manu capere, <hi rend="ital">to seize, catch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita capitur (alces): alioqui difficile est eam mancipari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mancupatio: <entryFree id="n27827" type="main" key="mancu^pa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mancŭpātĭo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mancŭpĭum</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mancŭpo</orth>, v. mancip-.</entryFree>
mancus: <entryFree id="n27828" type="main" key="mancus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mancus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. man-āk, little; cf. Germ. mangeln</etym>, <sense id="n27828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">maimed, infirm</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n27828.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in a limb or member, esp. in the hand: <cit><quote lang="la">sciendum, scaevam non esse morbosum, praeterquam si, imbecillitate dextrae, validius sinistra utatur: sed hunc non scaevam, sed mancum esse dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancus et membris omnibus captus ac debilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mandata claudus, caecus, mutus, mancus, debilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancorum ac debilium dux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:825" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 825</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam mancus et exstinctae corpus non utile dextrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:48" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27828.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">infirm, defective, imperfect</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac debilis praetura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemplatio naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 88</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">talibus officiis prope mancus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr</hi> adverb.: error mancum claudicat, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 23.</sense></entryFree>
mandatarius: <entryFree id="n27829" type="main" key="manda_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandātārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mandatum</etym>, <sense id="n27829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one to whom a charge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commission is given, an attorney, agent, mandatory</hi> (jurid. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:10:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 10, § 11</bibl> dub. (al. mandatores).</sense></entryFree>
mandatela: <entryFree id="n27830" type="main" key="manda_te_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandātēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a charge, the intrusting of a commission</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:104" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 622</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
mandatio: <entryFree id="n27831" type="main" key="manda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. mando</etym>, <sense id="n27831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a charge, commission</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mandatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:37" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 37 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> (dub.; al. traditione).</sense></entryFree>
mandativus: <entryFree id="n27832" type="main" key="manda_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a charge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">command, mandative</hi>: modus, a name given by some grammarians to <hi rend="ital">the future used imperatively</hi> (e. g. leges for lege), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 330</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
mandator: <entryFree id="n27833" type="main" key="manda_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who gives a charge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commission, a mandator</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27833.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod extra mandatum egit, non praejudicet mandatori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:17" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:22" default="NO">17, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 23, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27833.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27833.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One who instigates</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suborns accusers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">informers</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">et delatores mandatoresque erant ex licentia veteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delator compellitur edere mandatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27833.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One by whose authority money is lent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:59 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 59 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
mandatorius: <entryFree id="n27834" type="main" key="manda_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mandator</etym>, <sense id="n27834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mandator, mandatory</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nomine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 41, 19 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
mandatrix: <entryFree id="n27835" type="main" key="manda_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that charges</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commands</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">operum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 235</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mandatum: <entryFree id="n27836" type="main" key="manda_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 1. mando <sense id="n27836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mandatus: <entryFree id="n27837" type="main" key="manda_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of mando, q. v.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27838" type="main" key="manda_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in <sense id="n27838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. mando</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a command, mandate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mandatu Caesenniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sullae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitur mandatu meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1107" /> <cb n="MAND" /></sense></entryFree>
mandela: <entryFree id="n27839" type="hapax" key="Mande_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mandēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the Sabine territory, near the Digentia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 105</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mandēlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mandela</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">MASSA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mandibula: <entryFree id="n27840" type="main" key="mandi^bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandĭbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mandĭbŭ-lum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. mando</etym>, <sense id="n27840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jaw</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibaria confecta mandibulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 7, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 11, 1, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mando: <entryFree id="n27841" type="main" key="mando1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mando</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>manusdo</etym>, <sense id="n27841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to commit to one's charge, to enjoin, commission, order, command</hi> (syn.: praecipio, edico); constr. <hi rend="ital">alicui aliquid</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ut, ne</hi>, the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n27841.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27841.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi de nostris rebus nihil sum mandaturus per litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterea typos tibi mando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid velis, huic mandes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Clodio mandasse, quae illum mecum loqui velles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui mandare laqueum,</quote> <trans><tr>to bid go and be hanged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 57</bibl></cit>.—With ellipsis of <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam hoc senatus mandasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:39:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 39, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ego numquam mandavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:225" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 225</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27841.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Voluseno mandat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandat ut exploratores in Suebos mittant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar per litteras Trebonio magnopere mandaverat, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27841.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic mandat, Remos reliquosque Belgas adeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27841.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandavit Tigranen Armeniā exturbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aliter cineres mando jacere meos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:88:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 88, 10</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecerunt ut eis mandatum fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:45:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 45, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27841.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27841.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to commit, consign, enjoin, confide, commend, intrust</hi> any thing to a person or thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ego tibi meas res mando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona nostra haec tibi permitto et tuae mando fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludibrio habeor ... ab illo, quoi me mandavisti, meo viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(adulescens) qui tuae mandatus est fide et fiduciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem alicui alendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui magistratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:37:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 37, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiam viro,</quote> <trans><tr>to give in marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aeternis tenebris vinculisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se fugae,</quote> <trans><tr>to betake one's self to flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugae et solitudini vitam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen terrae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to sow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordea sulcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus humo,</quote> <trans><tr>to bury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid memoriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris,</quote> <trans><tr>to commit to writing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptis actiones nostras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:32:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 32, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges conditas vetustati,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep for a long time, to suffer to grow old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alcibiadem interficiendum insidiis mandare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudio mandante ac volente (opp. invito),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 16, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27841.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To charge a person to announce</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">to send word to</hi> a person or place only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">mandare ad Pisonem, noli, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandabat in urbem, nullum proelio finem exspectarent,</quote> <trans><tr>sent word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre ad nuptam quae mittit adulter, quae mandat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatui mandavit, bellum se ei illaturum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulantes, si quid ad uxores suas mandarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—<pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mandā-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a charge, order, commission, injunction, command</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27841.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mandatum scias me procurasse,</quote> <trans><tr>have performed the commission</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mandatum accepi a Patre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Joh. 10, 18</bibl></cit>.—More freq. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus ei de rebus, quas agi a me voles, mandata des, velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare mandata alicui in aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare alicui mandata, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persequi,</quote> <trans><tr>to perform, execute, fulfil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus exhaurire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exponere in senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:9:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to deliver</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegere,</quote> <trans><tr>to neglect, not perform</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 696</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec mandata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54, 4</bibl></cit>: legatis occulta mandata <cb n="MAND" /> data sint, ut, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 34, 1, 5</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">producetque virum, dabit et mandata reverti,</quote> <trans><tr>and enjoin him to return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27841.10" n="B" level="2"> Esp. as legal term. </sense><sense id="n27841.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A commission</hi> constituting a mutual obligation; hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a contract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandatum constitit, sive nostra gratia mandamus, sive alienā: id est, sive ut mea negotia geras, sive ut alterius mandem tibi, erit mandati obligatio, et invicem alter alteri tenebimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:155" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 155</bibl></cit> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque mandati constitutum est judicium non minus turpe, quam furti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>for breach of contract</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio mandati,</quote> <trans><tr>an action for the non-performance of a contract</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:8:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 8, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27841.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An imperial command, mandate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:110:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 110, 1</bibl>; Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 3</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of <hi rend="ital">the secret orders</hi> of the emperors: <cit><quote lang="la">(Galba) mandata Neronis de nece sua deprenderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occulta mandata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingere scelesta mandata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 71</bibl></cit>; 3, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27841.13" n="C" level="2"> In eccl. lang., <hi rend="ital">the law</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commandment of God</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandatum hoc, quod ego praecipio tibi hodie, non supra te est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 30, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec custodisti mandata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Reg. 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximum et primum mandatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:22:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 22, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27842" type="main" key="mando2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mando</orth>, <itype>di, sum</itype> (in the <sense id="n27842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form mandor, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 799</bibl> P.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>akin to madeo, properly to moisten; hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to chew, masticate</hi> (syn. manduco). </sense><sense id="n27842.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">animalia alia sugunt, alia carpunt, alia vorant, alia mandunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asini lentissime mandunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 14</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(equi) fulvum mandunt sub dentibus aurum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>champ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristia vulnera saevo dente,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to eat the flesh of slaughtered animals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 92</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: mansum ex ore daturum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 140, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia minima mansa in os inserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cibos mansos ac prope liquefactos demittimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27842.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to eat, devour</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): quom socios nostros mandisset impiu' Cyclops, Liv. Andr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 817</bibl> P.; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 683</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 141 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">apros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 78, § 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diomedes immanibus equis mandendos solitus objectare advenas,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw to them for food</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: mandere humum (like mordere humum), <hi rend="ital">to bite the ground</hi>, said of those who fall in battle, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 669</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">compressa aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:106" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 106</bibl></cit>: corpora Graiorum maerebat mandier igni, <hi rend="ital">to be consumed</hi>, Matius in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=95" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 95</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27843" type="hapax" key="mando3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mando</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. mando</etym>, <sense id="n27843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glutton, gormandizer</hi>: mandonum gulae, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 17, 16</bibl>; cf. manduco.</sense></entryFree>
mandonius: <entryFree id="n27844" type="main" key="Mando^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mandŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mando/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n27844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a general in Spain, who sided with the Romans in the second Punic war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:31" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 31</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
mandra: <entryFree id="n27845" type="greek" key="mandra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/ndra</foreign>, <sense id="n27845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pen for cattle</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n27845.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:22:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 22, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27845.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27845.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A herd of cattle</hi>: stantis convicia mandrae, <hi rend="ital">abuse from the herd penned up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stopped</hi>, i. e. from the drovers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:237" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 237</bibl>; cf.: mandrae, locus in quo porci includuntur, Vet. Schol. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n27845.4" n="B" level="2"> In <hi rend="ital">plur., a checkered draught-board, gaming-table</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincas Novium Publiumque mandris clusos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>penned up in the squares</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:72:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 72, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mandragoras: <entryFree id="n27846" type="greek" key="mandra^go^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandrăgŏras</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mandrago/ras</foreign>, <sense id="n27846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, mandrake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandragoras illitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 110, § 175</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 13, 94, § 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mandropolis: <entryFree id="n27847" type="hapax" key="Mandro^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mandrŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mandro/polis</foreign>, <sense id="n27847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Great Phrygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mandubii: <entryFree id="n27848" type="main" key="Mandu_bi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mandūbĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Celtica, <hi rend="ital">whose chief city was</hi> Alesia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manducatio: <entryFree id="n27849" type="main" key="mandu_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandūcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. manduco</etym>, <sense id="n27849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chewing</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Joann. 27" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Joann. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manducator: <entryFree id="n27850" type="main" key="mandu_ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandūcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chewer</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Joann. 27" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Joann. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manduco: <entryFree id="n27851" type="main" key="mandu_co1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandūco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (in the <sense id="n27851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mandūcor</orth>, <itype>ari</itype>, Lucil., Afran., and Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 477, 8 sq.</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Com. Rel. v. 100" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> Com. Rel. v. 100</bibl> Rib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. v. 184" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. v. 184</bibl>); cf. Prisc. <cb n="MANE" /> 799 P.), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>a lengthened form of 2 mando</etym>. </sense><sense id="n27851.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to chew, masticate; to eat by chewing</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">manducato candido pane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27851.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to eat, devour</hi>: bucceas, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl>: crudum manduces Priamum Priamique pisinnos, Labeo in Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27852" type="main" key="mandu_co2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandūco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. manduco</etym>, <sense id="n27852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glutton, gormandizer</hi> (post-class.), Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 17, 15</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 112 Rib.); <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 186, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manducor: <entryFree id="n27853" type="main" key="mandu_cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandūcor</orth>, <itype>ari</itype>, v. 1. manduco <sense id="n27853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
manducus: <entryFree id="n27854" type="main" key="mandu_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mandūcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. manduco</etym>, <sense id="n27854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glutton</hi> (ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n27854.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 17, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27854.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a ludicrous masked figure representing a person chewing</hi>, used in processions and in comedies to excite merriment: manduci effigies in pompa antiquorum inter ceteras ridiculas formidolosasque ire solebat magnis malis ac late dehiscens et ingentem dentibus sonitum faciens, de qua Plautus (Rud. 2, 6, 51), etc., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=128" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 128</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=95" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 95</bibl>; and E. Munk. de Fab. Atell. p. 39 sq.</sense></entryFree>
manduria: <entryFree id="n27855" type="main" key="Mandu_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mandūrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the Salentines, in Lower Italy, between Aletium and Tarentum</hi>, still called <hi rend="ital">Manduria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 15, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mane: <entryFree id="n27856" type="main" key="ma_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māne</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> (archaic <case>abl.</case> mani, like luci, vesperi: <sense id="n27856.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">a mani ad vesperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 37</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>old Lat. manus, good; whence immanis; cf.
