Manes</etym>. </sense><sense id="n27856.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The morning, morn.</hi> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes vigilabat ad ipsum Mane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a primo mane opus aggredi,</quote> <trans><tr>at the earliest dawn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mane novum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(litteras) multo mane mihi dedit,</quote> <trans><tr>very early in the morning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mane totum dormies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:49:36" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 49, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mane erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:547" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 547</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a mane usque ad vesperam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 18</bibl></cit>: a mane diei, Auct. B. Afr. 42.—</sense><sense id="n27856.2" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">adv., in the morning, early in the morning</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">postridie ejus diei, mane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hodie mane,</quote> <trans><tr>this morning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras mane,</quote> <trans><tr>to-morrow morning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hodierno die, mane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 9, 21</bibl></cit>.—Connected with other adverbs: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis paene mane est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene mane,</quote> <trans><tr>very early in the morning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo mane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam mane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plane mane,</quote> <trans><tr>quite early in the morning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manentia: <entryFree id="n27857" type="main" key="manenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">manentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>maneo</etym>, <sense id="n27857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">permanency</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">substantia habet manentiam quandam ut ita dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 11:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 11, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maneo: <entryFree id="n27858" type="main" key="ma^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĕo</orth>, <itype>nsi, nsum</itype> (contr. <sense id="n27858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> mansti for mansisti, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 8</bibl>), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [root man, to think; whence the notion of hesitating leads to that of waiting; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">me/nw, me/nos, mimnh/skw, ma/ntis</foreign>; and Lat. memini, moneo, mens, etc.]. </sense><sense id="n27858.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to stay, remain</hi> anywhere (class.). </sense><sense id="n27858.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ut erat, mansum tamen oportuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilem esse rem, seu maneant, seu proficiscantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 26, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si consulem manere ad urbem senatui placuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno loco manens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum manere diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:24:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 24, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diebus quindecim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gal. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia excogitantur, quare nec sine periculo maneatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Italia fortasse manebitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:16:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manendum eo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic maneri diutius non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27858.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n27858.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To stay, tarry, stop, continue, abide, pass the night</hi> ( = pernoctare): <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo die mansit Venafri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabernaculo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub Jove frigido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra domum patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 45, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad decimum lapidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 69, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum is Casilini eo die mansurum eum dixisset = Casilini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 13, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">triduom hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud alium mansit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:17:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mane apud me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 29, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manebis clam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Reg. 19, 2</bibl></cit>. —In mal. part.: cum masculo mansione muliebri, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 5, 1, 1. —</sense><sense id="n27858.5" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to remain, last, endure, continue</hi><pb n="1108" /> <cb n="MANG" />  in any place or manner: <cit><quote lang="la">si in eo manerent, quod convenisset,</quote> <trans><tr>would adhere to, abide by that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vita,</quote> <trans><tr>to remain alive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in veritate,</quote> <trans><tr>to adhere to the truth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:63:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 63, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in condicione,</quote> <trans><tr>to fulfil a condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sententia,</quote> <trans><tr>to adhere to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in voluntate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pristina mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 27, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:47" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu modo promissis maneas,</quote> <trans><tr>abide by, keep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pactione,</quote> <trans><tr>to abide by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an credi posse ullum populum in ea condicione mansurum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansit in condicione atque pacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique negant Caesarem in condicione mansurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. and abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil semper suo statu manet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: adfinitas. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum omnium mutabilium immutabiles manent origines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manent ingenia senibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>to continue, not be at an end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus quidem tibi fatum manet,</quote> <trans><tr>awaits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">maneat ergo, quod turpe sit, id numquam esse utile,</quote> <trans><tr>be it regarded as a settled principle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 12, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem illud maneat, et fixum sit, quod neque moveri, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 25</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Part. act. fut.</hi>: mansurus, <hi rend="ital">that which will abide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">endure; lasting, permanent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 86</bibl></cit>.—So <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi> manens: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 13, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27858.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to wait for, await, expect</hi> a person or thing (not in Cic. or Cæs.; syn.: opperior, praestolor, expecto). </sense><sense id="n27858.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc te, nox, quae me mansisti, mitto ut concedas die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non manebat aetas virginis meam neclegentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium adventum mansit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27858.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to await</hi> one (as his fate, portion, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to be about to befall</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">mors sua quemque manet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:21:58" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 21, 58</bibl></cit> (3, 26, 12): <cit><quote lang="la">quis me manet exitus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui si manet exitus urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera quos maneant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:540" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 540</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (acerba) manent victos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maneat nostros ea cura nepotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula et tribulationes me manent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:20:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 20, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manes: <entryFree id="n27859" type="main" key="Ma_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mānes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype> (<sense id="n27859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, Inscr. ap. Fea, Var. di Notiz. p. 174; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 786, 5</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>manus, good; v. mane</etym>, with or without di. </sense><sense id="n27859.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The deified souls of the departed, the ghosts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shades of the dead, the gods of the Lower World, infernal deities, manes</hi> (as benevolent spirits, opp. to larvae and lemures, malevolent spirits): <cit><quote lang="la">deorum manium jura sancta sunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Manibus divis mactatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 759</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Manibu' divis Inferias mittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrae (res) sunt quae Dis superis consecratae sunt: religiosae, quae Diis manibus relictae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27859.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the departed spirit, ghost, shade</hi> of a person: <cit><quote lang="la">nec patris Anchisae cinerem manesve revelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 119</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 303: manes Virginiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">camilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:16:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 16, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 7</bibl></cit>. —In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomine Manem deum nuncupant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. 15, p. 50, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27859.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27859.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Lower World, infernal regions</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Manesque profundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec Manes veniet mihi fama sub imos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse aliquos Manes et subterranea regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:149" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 149</bibl></cit>. And in apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulae Manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27859.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Punishments inflicted in the Lower World</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quisque suos patimur Manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 743</bibl></cit> (Manes id est supplicia, Serv.); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:84" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ephem. 57</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n27859.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A corpse</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">accipiet manes parvula testa meos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit> (3, 5, 16); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea causa est, ut pleraeque alitum e manibus hominum oculos potissimum appetant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:234" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 44, 85, § 234</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manetho: <entryFree id="n27860" type="main" key="Mane^tho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Manĕtho</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Manĕthos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*mane/qwn</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*mane/qws</foreign>, <sense id="n27860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a priest of Heliopolis, who wrote a history of Egypt in Greek</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
mango: <entryFree id="n27861" type="main" key="mango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mango</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ma/gganon</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n27861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dealer, monger</hi> in slaves or wares, to which he <cb n="MANI" /> tries to give an appearance of greater value, by adorning them (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mangones quicquid est quod displiceat, aliquo lenocinio abscondunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia pro puero centum me mango poposcit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:58:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 58, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non puer avari sectus arte mangonis, Virilitatis damna maeret ereptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:7:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 22, § 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mangones, qui colorem fuco mentiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non a mangone petitus quisquam erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:147" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 147</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">a furbisher, polisher</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 76, § 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:98" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 20, 43, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:40" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 22, § 40</bibl>; cf. Sillig. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mangonico: <entryFree id="n27862" type="main" key="mango_nico"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mangōnico</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-izo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mango</etym>, <sense id="n27862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set off, deck, adorn</hi> an article for sale (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ita pueros mangonicavit saepe obstetrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 47, § 135</bibl></cit>. —In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mangonicatae villae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27862.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to set off, adorn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mangonicus: <entryFree id="n27863" type="main" key="mango_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mangōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a dealer</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">venalicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 26, 97, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mangonium: <entryFree id="n27864" type="main" key="mango_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mangōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a setting off, displaying</hi> of wares (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 50, 71, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mangonizo: <entryFree id="n27865" type="main" key="mango_ni_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mangōnīzo</orth>, v. mangonico.</entryFree>
mani: <entryFree id="n27866" type="main" key="ma_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māni</orth>, <case>abl.</case>, v. mane <sense id="n27866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mania: <entryFree id="n27867" type="main" key="Ma_ni^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n27867.0" n="I" level="1"> In the Roman religion, <hi rend="ital">the mother of the Lares</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 61</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7, 34 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 124</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 164</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27867.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bugbear, bugaboo</hi> for children, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: Maniae turpes deformesque personae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=144" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 144</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27868" type="main" key="ma^ni^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mani:a</foreign>, <sense id="n27868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">madness</hi> (syn.: furor, insania, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:12:107" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 12, 107</bibl>.—As a disease of cattle, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 2, 19</bibl> Gesn. (Schneid. insania).</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n27869" type="main" key="Ma_ni^a3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Manius.</entryFree>
manibrium: <entryFree id="n27870" type="main" key="ma^ni_^bri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănī^brĭum</orth>, v. manubrium.</entryFree>
manibula: <entryFree id="n27871" type="main" key="ma^ni^bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭbŭla</orth>, v. 2. manicula.</entryFree>
manicae: <entryFree id="n27872" type="main" key="ma^ni^cae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭcae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>manus</etym>, <sense id="n27872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the long sleeve of a tunic</hi>, reaching to the hand, and which therefore supplied the place of our <hi rend="ital">glove</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27872.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tunicae manicas (habent),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem vestitus superioris in manicas non extendunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notarius, cujus manus hieme manicis muniebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: de pellibus, <hi rend="ital">sleeves of skins</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fur</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43, 4</bibl>: miror, tamdiu morari Antonium: solet enim accipere ipse manicas, <hi rend="ital">fur-gloves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a muff</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 11, 26</bibl>.—For soldiers in battle, as a protector against an enemy's weapon, <hi rend="ital">an armlet, gauntlet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:255" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 255</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27872.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27872.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A handcuff, manacle</hi> (cf. pedicae): quid si manus manicis restringantur? quid si pedes pedicis coarctentur? App <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3, p. 357" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, p. 357</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi manus manicae complexae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manicas alicui inicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manicisque jacentem Occupat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 439</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n27872.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">manacles, fetters</hi>: sic laqueis, manicis, pedicis mens irretita est, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 350, 25</bibl>.—*</sense><sense id="n27872.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A grappling-iron</hi>, with which an enemy's ship was held fast (usu. harpago), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 565</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manicarius: <entryFree id="n27873" type="gloss" key="ma^ni^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>manicae</etym> <sense id="n27873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a manacler</hi>, a gladiator who sought to manacle his opponent; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">LAQVEATOR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2566</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manicatus: <entryFree id="n27874" type="main" key="ma^ni^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with long sleeves</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:21" default="NO">11, 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manichaei: <entryFree id="n27875" type="main" key="Ma^nichaei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mănichaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heretical Christian sect</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1025</bibl>; Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 3, 4.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Măni-chaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manicleatus: <entryFree id="n27876" type="hapax" key="maniclea_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">manicleātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>manicae</etym>, <sense id="n27876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with long sleeves</hi>, for manicatus: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 22, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manico: <entryFree id="n27877" type="main" key="ma_ni^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mānĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>mane</etym>, <sense id="n27877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to come in the morning</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnis populus ad eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:21:38 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 21, 38 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
manicon: <entryFree id="n27878" type="greek" key="ma^ni^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">maniko:n</foreign>, <sense id="n27878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, the juice of which maddens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manicula: <entryFree id="n27879" type="main" key="ma^ni^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>manus</etym>. <sense id="n27879.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a little hand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 125</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n27879.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (cf. Engl. handle), <hi rend="ital">the handle</hi> <cb n="MANI" /> <hi rend="ital">of a plough, plough-tail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=136" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 136</bibl> Müll. (al. manibula).</sense></entryFree>
manifestarius: <entryFree id="n27880" type="main" key="ma^ni^festa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭfestārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>manifestus</etym>, <sense id="n27880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">palpable, plain, clear, evident, manifest</hi> (ante- and post-class. for manifestus): <cit><quote lang="la">fur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moechus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneo hunc manifestarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 50</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soloecismus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manifestatio: <entryFree id="n27881" type="main" key="ma^ni^festa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭfestātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. manifesto</etym>, <sense id="n27881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a manifesting, manifestation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">suae praesentiae, Aug. Civ. Dei, 20, 30: tantae virtutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manifestator: <entryFree id="n27882" type="main" key="ma^ni^festa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭfestātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a discoverer, shower, manifester</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus rei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 14, 6</bibl></cit>; Acron ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manifeste: <entryFree id="n27883" type="main" key="ma^ni^feste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭfestē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. manifestus <sense id="n27883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
manifesto: <entryFree id="n27884" type="main" key="ma^ni^festo_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭfestō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. manifestus <sense id="n27884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27885" type="main" key="ma^ni^festo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭfesto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>manifestus</etym>, <sense id="n27885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make public, discover, show clearly, exhibit, manifest</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem latentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratam voluntatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:6:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 6, 10</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: quod vel ex eo manifestari, quod, <hi rend="ital">was plain from the fact that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:3:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per se ipsa manifestata delectant,</quote> <trans><tr>revelations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 4:12" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
manifestus: <entryFree id="n27886" type="main" key="ma^ni^festus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭfestus</orth>, old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭfestus</orth> (v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:867" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 867</bibl>), a, um. <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>manus and fendo; cf.: defendo, offendo, i. e. that one hits by the hand; hence</etym>, <sense id="n27886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">palpable, clear, plain, apparent, evident, manifest</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27886.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">manifesta res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penates multo manifesti lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ita notas, ita manifestas proferam, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 16, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et apertae res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manifestus ex opere labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phrenesis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:136" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 136</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manifestus nosci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:759" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 759</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manifestior fraus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 123</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manifestissimum exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:10:60:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, 3</bibl></cit> 165.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. sing.</hi> with a <hi rend="ital">subjectclause, it is manifest that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manifestum est, ab exordio matutino latitudines scandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 16, 13, § 69</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭfesta</orth>, <itype>orum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">obvious facts, palpable things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera ac manifesta canere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:64" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27886.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., law t. t. </sense><sense id="n27886.3" n="A" level="2"> Of offences, <hi rend="ital">exposed, brought to light, proved by direct evidence</hi>: manifestum furtum est quod deprehenditur dum fit, Masur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque deprehensum scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:183" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 183</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 31, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27886.4" n="B" level="2"> Of offenders, <hi rend="ital">convicted of</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">caught</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apprehended in, manifestly betraying</hi> any thing; constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with a <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n27886.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec magis manufestum ego hominem umquam ullum teneri vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eos (sc. conjuratos) quam maxume manifestos habeant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bring to light, expose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocentes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>evidently guilty</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Nux, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27886.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum capitalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 52, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:313" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>giving manifest signs of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnae cogitationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novarum virium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27886.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissentire manifestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 57</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭfestō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">class.</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭ-festē</orth> (post-class.), <hi rend="ital">palpably, clearly, openly, evidently, manifestly</hi>.—Form manifesto: <cit><quote lang="la">teneor manifesto miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter alterum manifesto prehendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tota res a vobis manifesto deprehenderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compertum atque deprehensum facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum manifesto venenum deprehendisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 45, § 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:148" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 45, 69, § 148</bibl>. —Form manifeste, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 2, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:243" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 243</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manifeste comperire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 180, 5</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manifestius ipsi apparere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 88</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnibus manifestissime pateat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 316, 26</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:2:32:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 2, 32, § 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 18, 2, § 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manifolium: <entryFree id="n27887" type="main" key="ma^ni^fo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭfŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of burdock</hi>, also called personata, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manilius: <entryFree id="n27888" type="main" key="Ma_ni_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mānīlĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n27888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, </sense><sense id="n27888.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Manilius, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi> <pb n="1109" /> <cb n="MANI" /> A. U. C. 687, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 24, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 13:51" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 13, 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27888.2" n="2" level="3"> A. Manilius, <hi rend="ital">the astronomer and poet, author of the poem</hi> Astronomica.—</sense><sense id="n27888.3" n="3" level="3"> In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: * <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mānīlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a courtesan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:S. 6:243" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> S. 6, 243</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27888.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mānīlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Manilius, Manilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <trans><tr>of C. Manilius, according to which the chief command against Mithridates was given to Pompey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 29, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27888.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mā-nīlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Manilian</hi>: leges, <hi rend="ital">respecting the sale of slaves, probably introduced by</hi> M'. Manilius Nepos (<hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A. U. C. 605), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 246</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maniolae: <entryFree id="n27889" type="gloss" key="ma_ni^o^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mānĭŏlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>maniae</etym>, <sense id="n27889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little bugaboos</hi> for children, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=128" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 128</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
maniopoeos: <entryFree id="n27890" type="greek" key="ma^ni^o^poeos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭŏpoeos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">maniopoio/s</foreign> (making mad), <sense id="n27890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a term applied to henbane</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maniosus: <entryFree id="n27891" type="hapax" key="ma^ni^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. mania</etym>, <sense id="n27891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of madness, utterly crazed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4, 16</bibl> dub. (al. famosus).</sense></entryFree>
maniplaris: <entryFree id="n27892" type="main" key="ma^ni^pla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭplāris</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mănīplus</orth>, v. manipularis, etc.</entryFree>
manipretium: <entryFree id="n27893" type="main" key="ma^ni^pre^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭprĕtĭum</orth>, v. manupretium.</entryFree>
manipularis: <entryFree id="n27894" type="main" key="ma^ni^pu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭpŭlāris</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mănū^pŭlāris</orth> (sync. <orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭplāris</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mănū^plāris</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>manipulus</etym>, with <sense id="n27894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">miles</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a maniple</hi> or <hi rend="ital">company, manipular</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pertica suspensos portabat longa maniplos: Unde maniplaris nomina miles habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:117" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manipulares judices,</quote> <trans><tr>who once were common soldiers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: imperator, <hi rend="ital">one who rose from the ranks to be general</hi> (of C. Marius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 53, § 150</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27894.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭpŭlāris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-plaris</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a soldier of a maniple, a common soldier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium, tanquam unus manipularis, secutus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rufus diu manipularis, dein centurio, mox praefectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non placet quem scurrae laudant, manipularis mussitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimo quoque manipularium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27894.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a soldier of the same maniple, a fellow-soldier, comrade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam ex opsidione in tatum eduxi manuplaris meos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si centuriati bene sunt manuplares mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conveniunt manuplares eccos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centurio, tres suos nactus manipulares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47</bibl></cit>: mei. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manipularius: <entryFree id="n27895" type="main" key="ma^ni^pu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭpŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a maniple</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to a common soldier</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">manipulario habitu,</quote> <trans><tr>in the dress of a private</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manipulatim: <entryFree id="n27896" type="main" key="ma^ni^pu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭpŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n27896.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">By handfuls, in bundles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 13, 28, § 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27896.1" n="II" level="1"> Milit., <hi rend="ital">by maniples</hi>: manipulatim resistere hostibus, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 141, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manipulatim structa acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 8, 2</bibl>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">manipulatim munerigeruli facite mihi jam ante aedīs hic adsint,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in troops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manipulus: <entryFree id="n27897" type="main" key="ma^ni^pu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭpŭlus</orth> (sync. <orth extent="full" lang="la">mănīplus</orth>, in poets; <number>plur.</number>: <sense id="n27897.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">inter manipula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadrian. 10</bibl></cit>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>manus-pleo, plenus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a handful, a bundle</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27897.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de his (herbis) manipulos fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:49" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manipulos obligare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:40" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:19:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alligari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filicumque maniplis Sternere humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nexos deferre maniplos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:315" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maniplos solvere,</quote> <trans><tr>the bundles of hay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:153" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 153</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27897.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27897.3" n="A" level="2"> = <foreign lang="greek">a(lth=res</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">pieces of metal held in the hand during gymnastic exercises, to increase the momentum of a leap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stroke</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 2, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27897.4" n="B" level="2"> Because the ancient Romans adopted a pole, with a handful of hay or straw twisted about it, as the standard of a company of soldiers; in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a certain number of soldiers belonging to the same standard, a company, maniple;</hi> generally applied to infantry, and only by way of exception to cavalry: <cit><quote lang="la">miles pulcre centuriatus est expuncto in manipulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertica suspensos portabat longa maniplos: Unde maniplaris nomina miles habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:117" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo ut iidem ordines, manipulique constarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manipulos laxare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continere ad signa manipulos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in legione sunt manipuli triginta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of cavalry: <cit><quote lang="la">infrenati manipli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:316" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 316</bibl></cit>: <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 221, 5</bibl>.—Comically: <cb n="MANO" /> manipulus farum, <hi rend="ital">a troop, band</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manius: <entryFree id="n27898" type="main" key="Ma_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mānĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mane</etym>, <sense id="n27898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman prænomen</hi>, usually abbreviated M'., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 61</bibl> Müll.; cf.: Manius praenomen dictum est ab eo, quod mane quis initio natus sit, ut Lucius, qui luce, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=148" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 148</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
manlius: <entryFree id="n27899" type="main" key="Manli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Manlĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n27899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n27899.1" n="1" level="3"> So esp. M. Manlius Capitolinus, <hi rend="ital">who saved the Capitol in the Gallic war, but afterwards, suspected of aspiring to royal power, was thrown from the Tarpeian Rock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 11</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:27:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 27, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 13, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 44, 113</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n27899.2" n="2" level="3"> L. Manlius Torquatus, <hi rend="ital">a dictator, and his son</hi>, T. Manlius Torquatus, <hi rend="ital">a consul, each of whom, for his severity, was surnamed</hi> Imperiosus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 60</bibl> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27899.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Man-lĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Manlius, Manlian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27899.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Manlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Manlius, Manlian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (from L. Manlius Torquatus, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide, ne ista sint manliana vestra, aut majora etiam, si imperes quod facere non possim (preceded by ut nimis imperiosi philosophi sit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:32:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 32, 105</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Manlĭānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a villa belonging to Q. Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manna:
<entryFree id="n27900" type="greek" key="manna" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">manna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/nna</foreign>, <sense id="n27900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grain, a vegetable juice hardened into grains</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manna una turis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">croci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 39</bibl></cit>.
†† </sense><sense id="n27900.1" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">manna, man</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">manhu</orth>, <hi rend="ital">neutr. indecl.</hi>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">manna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Hebrew</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the manna</hi> of the Hebrews.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Filii Israël dixerunt ad invicem, Manhu, quod significat, Quid est hoc?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sume vas unum, et mitte ibi man, quantum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 131, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mannae cibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legimus, manna esui populo fuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27900.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">food for the soul, divine support</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manna absconditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 2, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mannulus:
<entryFree id="n27901" type="main" key="mannu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mannŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. mannus</etym>, <sense id="n27901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallic pony</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:24:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 24, 8</bibl>.
†† </sense><sense id="n27901.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mannus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of small Gallic horse, a coach-horse, cob</hi> (used esp. for pleasure-drives): <cit><quote lang="la">agens mannos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1063" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1063</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si per obliquum similis sagittae (serpens) Terruit mannos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapientibus esseda mannis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detonsi,</quote> <trans><tr>with shorn manes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 15: <cit><quote lang="la">obesi manni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense>
†† <sense id="n27901.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mannus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Germ. Mann, <foreign lang="greek">a)/nqrwpos</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a god of the ancient Germans, son of Tuisco</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mano: <entryFree id="n27902" type="main" key="ma_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n27902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [prob. for mad-no; Sanscr. madas, drunkenness; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">madaro/s</foreign>, flowing; cf.: madeo, madidus; also Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ma=no/s</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">to flow, run, trickle, drop, distil</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n27902.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27902.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: manat omni corpore sudor, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 399); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manat item nobis e toto corpore sudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:944" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 944</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidus toto manabat corpore sudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tepidae manant ex arbore guttae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 500</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons manat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:664" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:887" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 887</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculis simulacrum multo sudore manavit,</quote> <trans><tr>dripped with much sweat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa Lanuvii cruore manavere,</quote> <trans><tr>dripped with gore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:31:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 31, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultrum ex volnere extractum manante cruore prae se tenens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvei manantes per latera et fluctu superurgente,</quote> <trans><tr>leaking through the joints of the side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longā manantia labra salivā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:623" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 623</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27902.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to give out, shed, pour forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indica gemma in attritu sudorem purpureum manat,</quote> <trans><tr>gives out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 61, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas marmora manant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 312</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: fidis enim manare poëtica mella Te solum, <hi rend="ital">to distil poetic honey</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be a poet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 44</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n27902.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things not fluid, <hi rend="ital">to flow, diffuse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extend itself, to spread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër, qui per maria manat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus per aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:927" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 927</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa a luna manant, et fluunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manat dies ab oriente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 4</bibl></cit> Müll.: manare <cb n="MANS" /> solem antiqui dicebant, cum solis orientis radii splendorem jacere coepissent, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=158" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 158</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n27902.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to diffuse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extend itself, to spread, get abroad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum malum manaret in dies latius,</quote> <trans><tr>daily spreads farther</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">malum manavit per Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manat tota urbe rumor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manat et funditur disserendi ratio per omnes partis sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:25:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 25, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tristis a Mutina fama manaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen usque ad Pythagorae manavit aetatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei bonae nomen manat latissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 17, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manavit ea benignitas ex urbe etiam in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27902.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to flow, spring, arise, proceed, emanate, have its origin, originate</hi> from any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata ex vitiis manant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:1:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis honestas manat a partibus quattuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Aristippo Cyrenaica philosophia manavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde omnia manant, videre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27902.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To escape, be forgotten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne supervacuum pleno de pectore manat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 337</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manon: <entryFree id="n27903" type="greek" key="ma_non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mānon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mano/n</foreign>, <sense id="n27903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of soft sponge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 45, 69, § 148</bibl>; called also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mānos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">(spongearum genus) spissum et mollius manos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 45, 69, § 149</bibl></cit> Jan. (al. mana).—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> <itype>manoi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximae fiunt manoi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 45, 69, § 149</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mansio: <entryFree id="n27904" type="main" key="mansi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>maneo</etym>, <sense id="n27904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a staying, remaining, stay, continuance</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27904.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">is saepe mecum de tua mansione, aut decessione communicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansio Formiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excessus e vita et in vita mansio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 18, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautior certe est mansio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diutinae Lemni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: crebrae ad amicam, i. e. <hi rend="ital">visits</hi>, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 132, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27904.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (post-Aug.), <hi rend="ital">a place of abode, a dwelling, habitation</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27904.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecorum mansio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 23, 53, § 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestivae, hibernae, vernae, auctumnales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>;
