<bibl default="NO">1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansionem apud eum faciemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Joann. 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae mansiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27904.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n27904.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Night-quarters, lodging-place, inn;</hi> also, as a measure of days' journeys, <hi rend="ital">a stopping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">haltingplace, station</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde ad primam statim mansionem febrim nactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo (monte) octo mansionibus distat regio, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stations, days' journeys</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 30, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquationum ratione mansionibus dispositis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuatis mansionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:8:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27904.6" n="2" level="3"> Mala mansio, <hi rend="ital">bad quarters</hi>, a kind of punishment in which the culprit was stretched out and tied fast to a board, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:7" default="NO">16, 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mansionarius: <entryFree id="n27905" type="main" key="mansi^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mansio</etym>, <sense id="n27905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a dwelling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lodging</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">conjugium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mansito: <entryFree id="n27906" type="main" key="mansi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansĭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n27906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [maneo], <hi rend="ital">to stay, remain, tarry, abide, dwell</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pygargus in oppidis mansitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub eodem tecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass the night</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. maneo, B.; mansio, B. 1.</sense></entryFree>
mansiuncula: <entryFree id="n27907" type="main" key="mansi^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mansio</etym>, <sense id="n27907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little dwelling</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mansiunculas in arca facies,</quote> <trans><tr>chambers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 6, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mansor: <entryFree id="n27908" type="main" key="mansor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>maneo</etym>, <sense id="n27908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sojourner, indweller, guest</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">faciat (Deus nos) tanto mansore capaces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 5, 294</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mansorius: <entryFree id="n27909" type="main" key="manso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mansor</etym>, <sense id="n27909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abiding, permanent</hi> (opp. transitorius): <cit><quote lang="la">non quasi mansoria dilectio atque delectatio, sed transitoria potius, ut viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 1:35:39" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 1, 35, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mansuefacio: <entryFree id="n27910" type="main" key="mansu^e_fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansŭēfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n27910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.; pass.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mansŭēfīo</orth>, <itype>factus, fiĕri</itype> <etym>mansuetus-facio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make tame, to tame</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n27910.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansuefacimus animalia? indomita nascuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: uri assuescere ad homines et mansuefieri, ne parvuli quidem excepti, possunt, <hi rend="ital">grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become tame</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietes feri mansuefacti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigris mansuefactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 25, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grues mansuefactae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 23, 30, § 59</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes attritu domitum et consuetudine nitoris veluti mansuefactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 9, 20, § 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27910.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make gentle, to soften, civilize, pacify</hi>: a quibus (nos) mansuefacti et exculti, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deposita et mansuefacta barbaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferum ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 11</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1110" /> <cb n="MANT" /></sense></entryFree>
mansuefactio: <entryFree id="n27911" type="main" key="mansu^e_facti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansŭēfactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mansuefacio</etym>, <sense id="n27911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the taming</hi>: bestiarum, Aug. de Nat. et <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> 15, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mansuefactus: <entryFree id="n27912" type="main" key="mansu^e_factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansŭēfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from mansuefacio.</entryFree>
mansuefio: <entryFree id="n27913" type="main" key="mansu^e_fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansŭēfīo</orth>, <sense id="n27913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, from mansuefacio.</sense></entryFree>
mansues: <entryFree id="n27914" type="main" key="mansu^e_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansŭēs</orth>, <itype>ŭis, and ētis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>manussuesco</etym>, <sense id="n27914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tamed, tame</hi> (ante- and post-class. for mansuetus, v. mansuesco <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): mansues pro mansueto, dixit Cato in epistola ad filium, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=154" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 154</bibl> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=152:125" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 152, 125</bibl> Müll.: leonem facere mansuem, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 483, 9 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis et mansues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio ferocissimos equos atque truces mansuetos et mansues factos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, 23, p. 198, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursa mansues,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 7</bibl></cit>, p. 261, 1.—</sense><sense id="n27914.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">mild, soft, gentle</hi>: nunc si me matrem mansues misericordia capsit, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 483, 11</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 453 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">reddam ego te ex fera fame mansuetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 9, 9, § 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeone ego ted interdictis facere mansuetem meis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit> Ussing.</sense></entryFree>
mansuesco: <entryFree id="n27915" type="main" key="mansu^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansŭesco</orth>, <itype>sŭēvi, sŭētum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n27915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>manus-suesco; lit., to accustom to the hand; hence</etym>, </sense><sense id="n27915.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to tame, to make tame</hi> (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> ante- and post-class.; but cf. infra, mansuetus). </sense><sense id="n27915.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestria animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigres, Coripp. Johann. 6, 253: fructus feros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1368</bibl></cit>; v. Lachm. ad h. l.— *</sense><sense id="n27915.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to render mild, gentle</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">peaceable</hi>: gentes, Coripp. Johann. 6, 484.—</sense><sense id="n27915.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> ( = mansuetum fieri), <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow tame</hi> (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n27915.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">buculi triduo fere mansuescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 237</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27915.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow tame, gentle, mild, soft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nesciaque humanis precibus mansuescere corda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera mansuescere jussa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:104" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 104</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mansŭētus</orth> (MASVETA, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 688, 2</bibl>), a, um, <hi rend="ital">P. a., tamed, tame</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27915.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenci diebus paucis erunt mansueti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:20:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (apes) sint neque mansueti generis, neque feri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 5, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabula, i. e. mansuetarum pecudum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 164</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27915.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">mild, soft, gentle, quiet</hi>, etc. (syn. mitis; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. ferus): illud quaero, cur tam subito mansuetus in senatu fuerit, cum in edictis tam fuisset ferus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <trans><tr>tranquil, not stormy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 28</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: ut mitior mansuetiorque fiat, Asellio ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 668</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam me jam ab orationibus dijungo fere, referoque ad mansuetiores Musas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:6:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 6, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mansuetissimus viderer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:49:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 49, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mansŭētē</orth> (acc. to B.), <hi rend="ital">gently, mildly, calmly, quietly</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">clementer, mansuete factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo tum imperio meliori animus mansuete obediens erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre fortunam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 52, 65</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansuetius versari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 236, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mansuetarius: <entryFree id="n27916" type="main" key="mansu^e_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansŭētārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mansuetus</etym>, <sense id="n27916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tamer of wild beasts</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 21</bibl>; Firmic. 8, 17.</sense></entryFree>
mansuete: <entryFree id="n27917" type="main" key="mansu^e_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansŭētē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mansuetus <sense id="n27917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mansueto: <entryFree id="n27918" type="main" key="mansu^e_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansŭēto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>mansuetus</etym>, <sense id="n27918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make tame, to tame</hi> (late Lat. for mansuefacio): <cit><quote lang="la">mansuetabatur ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 16, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mansuetudo: <entryFree id="n27919" type="main" key="mansu^e_tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansŭētūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tameness</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27919.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">elephanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27919.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27919.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">mildness, gentleness, clemency</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">uti clementiā ac mansuetudine in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:44:section=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 44, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum genus orationis lenitatis et mansuetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:49:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 49, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27919.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in the times of the emperors, a complimentary title used in addressing them: mansuetudo tua, <hi rend="ital">your clemency</hi> or <hi rend="ital">your grace</hi>, Eutr. praef. ad Valent. Imp.</sense></entryFree>
mansuetus: <entryFree id="n27920" type="main" key="mansu^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansŭētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. mansuesco.</entryFree>
mansus: <entryFree id="n27921" type="main" key="mansus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mansus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n27921.0" n="I" level="1"> <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. mando.—</sense><sense id="n27921.1" n="II" level="1"> <mood>Part.</mood>, from maneo.</sense></entryFree>
mantele: <entryFree id="n27922" type="main" key="mante_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantēle</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mantīle</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mantēlĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mantīlĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>manus<cb n="MANT" />  and tela, properly a cloth for the hand</etym>, <sense id="n27922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a towel, napkin</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27922.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mantelium, ubi manus terguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=85" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 85</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsisque ferunt mantelia villis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 702</bibl></cit> (v. l. mantilia); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 377</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27922.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a table-cloth</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">mantelia nunc pro operiendis mensis sunt: quae, ut nomen ipsum indicat, olim tergendis manibus praebebantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 266</bibl></cit>; in form mantile, Treb. Galb. 16, 3.</sense></entryFree>
mantelum: <entryFree id="n27923" type="main" key="mante_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantēlum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mantellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>i. q. mantele, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n27923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cloth, napkin</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 4, 377</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=133:33" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 133, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2271</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27923.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cloak, mantle;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mendaciis subdolis mihi usquam mantelum est meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mantia: <entryFree id="n27924" type="greek" key="manti_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mantei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n27924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of the blackberry-bush</hi> among the Dacians, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mantica: <entryFree id="n27925" type="main" key="manti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>manus</etym>, <sense id="n27925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bag for the hand, wallet, cloak-bag, portmanteau</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mantica cui (mulo) lumbos onere ulceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umero exuere,</quote> <trans><tr>to take off from the shoulder</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 110, 27</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">non videmus, manticae quid in tergo est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>do not learn to know ourselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 22, 21</bibl></cit> (acc. to the fable, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 10, 1</bibl>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nemo in sese temptat descendere, nemo, sed praecedenti spectatur mantica tergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:24" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 24</bibl></cit> Gildersleeve ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
mantice: <entryFree id="n27926" type="main" key="manti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mantikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n27926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of prescience</hi>: divinationem quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">*mantikh\n</foreign> appellant, id est, praesensionem et scientiam rerum futurarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:13:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 13, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mantice Pronoës filia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mantichora: <entryFree id="n27927" type="greek" key="manti^cho_^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantĭchō^ra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mantixw/ras</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">mantixo/ras</foreign>, <sense id="n27927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous Indian beast, with a human face, a lion's body, and a scorpion's tail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:107" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 30, 45, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7:58" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manticinor: <entryFree id="n27928" type="hapax" key="manti^ci^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantĭcĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ma/ntis</foreign>cano</etym>, <sense id="n27928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to predict, prophesy, divine</hi> (comically formed, in imitation of vaticinor): <cit><quote lang="la">nisi ego manticinatus probe ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manticula: <entryFree id="n27929" type="main" key="manti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mantica</etym>, <sense id="n27929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small wallet, purse, pouch</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=133" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 133</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
manticularia: <entryFree id="n27930" type="gloss" key="manti^cula_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantĭculārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>obsol. <pos>adj.</pos> manticularius</etym>, <sense id="n27930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">handy little things, things in constant use</hi>: dicuntur ea, quae frequenter in usu habentur, et quasi manu tractantur. Frequens enim antiquis ad manus tergendas usus fuit mantelorum, unde haec trahitur similitudo, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=132" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 132</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
manticularius: <entryFree id="n27931" type="main" key="manti^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>manticulor</etym>, <sense id="n27931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutpurse</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manticulatio: <entryFree id="n27932" type="gloss" key="manti^cu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantĭcŭlātĭo</orth> <itype>fallacia vel lenocinium</itype>, Gloss. <bibl default="NO"><author>Placid.</author> p. 484</bibl>.</entryFree>
manticulator: <entryFree id="n27933" type="hapax" key="manti^cu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantĭcŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>manticulor</etym>, <sense id="n27933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pickpocket, sharper</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=133" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 133</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. v. 376 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
manticulor: <entryFree id="n27934" type="main" key="manti^cu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantĭcŭlor</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>manticula; lit., to be busied with purses; hence</etym>, <sense id="n27934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to steal</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum utrem ventosissimum manticularentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 55, p. 309, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27934.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to act slyly, go cunningly to work</hi>: manticularum usus pauperibus in nummis recondendis etiam nostro saeculo fuit. Unde manticulari dicebantur, qui furandi gratiā manticulos attrectabant. Inde poëtae pro dolose quid agendo usi sunt eo verbo, etc., Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=133" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 133</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. v. 376 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
mantile: <entryFree id="n27935" type="main" key="manti_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantīle</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mantīlĭum</orth>, v. mantele.</entryFree>
mantinea: <entryFree id="n27936" type="main" key="Mantine_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mantinēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*manti/neia</foreign>, <sense id="n27936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Arcadia, celebrated for the victory of Epaminondas over the Spartans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,015:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ep. 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mantisa: <entryFree id="n27937" type="foreign" key="manti_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantīsa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mantissa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Tuscan</etym>. <sense id="n27937.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a worthless addition, makeweight</hi>: mantisa additamentum dicitur lingua Tusca, quod ponderi adicitur, sed deterius et quod sine ullo usu est. Lucilius: mantisa obsonia vincit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=132:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 132, 11</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n27937.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">gain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
mantiscinor: <entryFree id="n27938" type="spur" key="mantisci^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantiscĭnor</orth>, a false read. for man ticinor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 115</bibl>.</entryFree>
manto: <entryFree id="n27939" type="main" key="manto1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">manto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <sense id="n27939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [maneo]. </sense><sense id="n27939.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to stay, remain, wait</hi> (ante-class.): in eādem mantat malitiā, <cb n="MANU" /> Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 505, 27</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 87 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">manta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque mantant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 34</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27939.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to wait for, await</hi> a person: <cit><quote lang="la">nos apud aedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: jam me adeo manta, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=133" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 133</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 34 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27940" type="main" key="Manto2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Manto</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mantw/</foreign>. <sense id="n27940.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The daughter of Tiresias, a prophetess, and mother of the seer Mopsus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 128" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:758" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 758</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 679</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27940.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Italian nymph who had the gift of prophecy, the mother of Ocnus, who founded the city of Mantua</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Ocnus) Fatidicae Mantūs et Tusci filius amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mantua: <entryFree id="n27941" type="main" key="Mantu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mantŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of</hi> Gallia Transpadana, <hi rend="ital">on the Mincius, in whose vicinity was Andes, the birthplace of Virgil</hi>, still called <hi rend="ital">Mantua</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 200</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mantua Vergilio gaudet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 15, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:595" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 595</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n27941.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mantŭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mantua</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to Virgil, Mantuan, Virgilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:7:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Octav. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 212</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Mantuanus Homerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Mantuanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <trans><tr>Virgil's poems</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mantuelis: <entryFree id="n27942" type="main" key="mantu^e_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantŭēlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mantelum</etym>, <sense id="n27942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cloakshaped, mantle-like</hi> (post-class.), Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mantum: <entryFree id="n27943" type="foreign" key="mantum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mantum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Spanish cloak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mantum Hispani vocant, quod manus tegat tantum: est enim breve amictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 24, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manturna: <entryFree id="n27944" type="main" key="Manturna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Manturna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>maneo</etym>, <sense id="n27944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of matrimony, who was invoked to render the marriage lasting</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 9.</sense></entryFree>
mantus: <entryFree id="n27945" type="main" key="Mantus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mantus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Etruscan Pluto, the god of the under-world</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 10, 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manua: <entryFree id="n27946" type="main" key="ma^nu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>manus</etym>, <sense id="n27946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a handful</hi>: manuae feni, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 154</bibl>: manua, <foreign lang="greek">dra/gma</foreign>, Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
manualis: <entryFree id="n27947" type="main" key="ma^nu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. manus</etym>, <sense id="n27947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the hand, for the hand, that is held in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fills the hand, hand-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27947.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (mostly post-Aug.): manuales lapides, <hi rend="ital">that can be thrown with the hand</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 449, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasciculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 30, 72, § 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 15, 80, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mola, Hier. in Chron. ad Ann. CCCVIII. a. Chr. n.: aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>for washing hands</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 39</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27947.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. involucrum), <hi rend="ital">the case</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covering of a book</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:84" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 84</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.—Plur.</hi>: manualia, <hi rend="ital">handbooks</hi>, Fragm. Vat. § 45 sq.</sense></entryFree>
manuarius: <entryFree id="n27948" type="main" key="ma^nu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the hand, for the hand, that fills the hand</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mola,</quote> <trans><tr>a hand-mill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 95</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">aes,</quote> <trans><tr>won with the hand at gaming, money won at dice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. manus.— </sense><sense id="n27948.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a thief</hi>: manuari, pudorem perdidisti, Lab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 3</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 46 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
manuatus: <entryFree id="n27949" type="main" key="ma^nu^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with hands</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 378</bibl>; v. also manuor.</sense></entryFree>
manuballista: <entryFree id="n27950" type="main" key="ma^nu^ballista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭ-ballista</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">balista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hand-ballista</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manuballistarius: <entryFree id="n27951" type="main" key="ma^nu^ballista_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭballistārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>manu-ballista</etym>, <sense id="n27951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who carries</hi> or <hi rend="ital">uses a hand-ballista</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manubiae: <entryFree id="n27952" type="main" key="ma^nu^bi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭbĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (in <number>sing.</number>, <sense id="n27952.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, II.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. manus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n27952.1" n="I" level="1"> In milit. and legal lang. </sense><sense id="n27952.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <hi rend="ital">money obtained from the sale of booty</hi> (opp. praeda, the booty itself). Of this money, one part was put into the ærarium, one was given to the soldiers, and the remainder to the general; this last part was usually expended by the general on public buildings: aliud omnino praeda est, ut in libris rerum verborumque veterum scriptum est, aliud manubiae. Nam praeda dicitur corpora ipsa rerum, quae capta sunt: manubiae vero appellatae sunt pecunia a quaestore ex venditione praedae redacta, etc. ... Est tamen nonnusquam invenire, ita scripsisse quosdam non ignobiles scriptores, ut aut temere aut incuriose praedam pro manubiis et manubias pro praeda posuerint, etc. ... Sed enim, qui proprie atque signate locuti sunt, manubias pecuni <pb n="1111" /> <cb n="MANU" /> am dixerunt, Favorin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:25 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 25 sq.</bibl>; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Anton. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Anton. 1, 2</bibl> Mai.: <cit><quote lang="la">qua ex praeda aut manubiis haec abs te donatio constituta est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:80:section=186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 80, § 186</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 22, 59</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui manubias sibi tantas ex L. Metelli manubiis fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Verr. 2:1:59:section=154" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 59, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manubias alicui concedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Rosc. Am. 37:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 37, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (rostra) censor imperatoriis manubiis ornarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:de Or. 3:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tullus Hostilius) sepsit de manubiis comitium et curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Rep. 2:17:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 17, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedem Fortis Fortunae de manubiis faciendam locavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de manubiis captarum urbium templum erexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:7:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delubrum Minervae ex manubiis dicavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 26, 27, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacratas ab Augusto manubias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the temple of Apollo, near Actium</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27952.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n27952.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Booty, spoils</hi> taken from the enemy (ante-class. and post-Aug.; cf. above the passage from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 25</bibl>), Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 138, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partiri manubias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 79 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contenti armorum manubiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:18:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 18, 6</bibl></cit>. —(The reading manubia machaera, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 35</bibl>, is doubtless corrupt.)—</sense><sense id="n27952.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Unlawful gain, plunder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad manubias et rapinas compulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27952.6" n="II" level="1"> In the lang. of augurs, <hi rend="ital">kinds of flashes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strokes of lightning, thunderbolts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres manubias ... prima ... secunda .. tertiam manubiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:41:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 41, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minervales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 429</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=129:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 129, 16</bibl>; p. 214, 25 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 896</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manubialis: <entryFree id="n27953" type="main" key="ma^nu^bi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭbĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>manubiae</etym>, <sense id="n27953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to booty</hi> (post-Aug.): pecunia, <hi rend="ital">derived from the sale of booty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de manubiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl></cit>; cf. manubiae, I. A.</sense></entryFree>
manubiarius: <entryFree id="n27954" type="hapax" key="ma^nu^bi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭbĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to booty;</hi> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus manubiarius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that brings one profit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manubius: <entryFree id="n27955" type="main" key="ma^nu^bi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭbĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. manubiae, I. B. 1 <sense id="n27955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
manubriatus: <entryFree id="n27956" type="main" key="ma^nu_bri^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănūbrĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>manubrium</etym>, <sense id="n27956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with a handle</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">manubriatae serrulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistri manubriatos cultros dexteris manibus gestabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manubriolum: <entryFree id="n27957" type="main" key="ma^nu_bri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănūbrĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little handle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">haft</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">scalpelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
manubrium: <entryFree id="n27958" type="main" key="ma^nu_bri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănūbrĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mănĭbrĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. manus</etym>, <sense id="n27958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is grasped</hi> or <hi rend="ital">held in the hand;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a handle, hilt, haft</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">trulla excavata, manubrio aureo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manubria, quorum optima sunt ilignea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:92" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bidentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ipsum manubrii foramen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:133" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistomiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Is etiam sese sapere memorat! Malleum sapientiorem scilicet esse manubrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 92</bibl></cit>: eximere alicui ex manu manubrium, <hi rend="ital">to take the handle out of one's hand</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to deprive one of the opportunity of doing a thing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manuciolum: <entryFree id="n27959" type="hapax" key="ma^nu^ci^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭcĭŏlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mănĭc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>manucium</etym>, <sense id="n27959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bundle</hi>, = manipulus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 63, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manucium: <entryFree id="n27960" type="gloss" key="ma^nu^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭcĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mănĭc-</orth>) [manus], = <foreign lang="greek">xeiri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glove, muff</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
manucla: <entryFree id="n27961" type="main" key="ma^nucla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănucla</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mănucŭla</orth>, v. manulea.</entryFree>
manuculatus: <entryFree id="n27962" type="main" key="ma^nu^cula_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭculātus</orth>, v. manuleatus.</entryFree>
manufactilis: <entryFree id="n27963" type="main" key="ma^nu^facti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭfactĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. manus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n27963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made by hand of man</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deum manufactilem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manufactus: <entryFree id="n27964" type="spur" key="ma^nu^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um, more correctly written as two words</itype>, manu factus.</entryFree>
manuinspex: <entryFree id="n27965" type="gloss" key="ma^nu^inspex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭinspex</orth> <etym>manus-inspicio</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">xeirosko/pos</foreign>, <sense id="n27965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hand-inspector, student</hi> or <hi rend="ital">practitioner of palmistry</hi>, Gloss. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
manulea: <entryFree id="n27966" type="main" key="ma^nu^le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭlĕa</orth> (al. leg. ap. Vitr. mănucŭla or mănucla), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. manus</etym>. * <sense id="n27966.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A long sleeve</hi> reaching to the hand, i. q. manica: quid tu amicam times ne te manulea cajet? Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Contin. Verg. p. 163</bibl> Muncker; v. cajo, and cf. manuleus.—</sense><sense id="n27966.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The trigger of a catapult</hi>, which held the cord in tension, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manulearius: <entryFree id="n27967" type="main" key="ma^nu^le^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭlĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>manulea</etym>, <sense id="n27967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of sleeves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">muffs</hi> for women (anteand post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Rein.</author> 2</bibl>, n. 83. <cb n="MANU" /></sense></entryFree>
manuleatus: <entryFree id="n27968" type="main" key="ma^nu^le^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭlĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>manulea</etym>, <sense id="n27968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with long sleeves</hi>, which were regarded as a proof of effeminacy (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">manuleatus et armillatus in publicum processit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manuleus: <entryFree id="n27969" type="main" key="ma^nu^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the long sleeve of a tunic</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug. for manica): actoribus manuleos, baltea, machaeras, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 194, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. 4, 3</bibl></cit> bis; cf. manulea, I.</sense></entryFree>
manumissio: <entryFree id="n27970" type="main" key="ma^nu_missi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănūmissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>manumitto</etym>, <sense id="n27970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the freeing of a slave, manumission</hi>. It was effected either per censum (when the person to be freed was registered in the census), or per testamentum, or per vindictam (v. vindicta, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 2, 10</bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">in these three cases it was called justa manumissio. A fourth mode, which, however, was less valid, consisted in pronouncing the slave free before (five) friends, or inviting him to table, or by letter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:29:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 29, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:17" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 24:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 24, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27970.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a remission of punishment, pardon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manumissor: <entryFree id="n27971" type="main" key="ma^nu_missor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănūmissor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who gives a slave his freedom, a liberator, emancipator</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:15:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manumissus: <entryFree id="n27972" type="main" key="ma^nu_missus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănūmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from manumitto.</entryFree>
manumitto: <entryFree id="n27973" type="main" key="ma^nu_mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănūmitto</orth> (also as two words, <sense id="n27973.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; and ante-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">manu emitto</orth>, v. emitto, I. B.), <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. manus-mitto</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to release from one's power</hi> (manus), <hi rend="ital">to set at liberty, to enfranchise, emancipate, make free</hi> a slave (v. manumissio): <cit><quote lang="la">quos (servos) nisi manumisisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 22, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt servi de cognatorum sententiā manumissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:29:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 29, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:77:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 77, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamento manumissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos proxime inter amicos manumisisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—Separated by other words: <cit><quote lang="la">orabo, ut manu me mittat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu vero cur miserit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu non mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 9, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
manuor: <entryFree id="n27974" type="main" key="ma^nu^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭor</orth>, <itype>ātus sum</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>manus</etym>, <sense id="n27974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to steal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laberius in mimis scripsit, manuatus est pro furatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manupretiosus: <entryFree id="n27975" type="hapax" key="ma^nu^pre^ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭprĕtĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>manupretium</etym>, <sense id="n27975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">precious, valuable, costly</hi>: vestimentum, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:23:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 23, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
manupretium: <entryFree id="n27976" type="main" key="ma^nu^pre^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭprĕtĭum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">mănĭpr-</orth>; and as two words, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭs prĕtĭum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mă-nŭi prĕtĭum</orth>; v. Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7, 4</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. manus-pretium</etym>, <sense id="n27976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a workman's</hi> or <hi rend="ital">artist's pay, wages.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27976.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">manupretium dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in auro, praeter manus pretium, nihil intertrimenti fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex manipretio cujusque signi denarios deponere aureos singulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 17, § 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27976.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pay, reward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manupretium perditae civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castrensium laborum tarda manupretia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27976.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the value of the work</hi> in a thing made by art, <hi rend="ital">the workmanship</hi> (opp. to the material; postclass.): manupretium dicitur, ubi non tam materiae ratio, quam manus atque artis ducitur, Ps. - Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque plus est in manus pretio, quam in re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manus: <entryFree id="n27977" type="main" key="ma^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<case>dat.</case> manu for manui: <sense id="n27977.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">alternae manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:60" default="NO">2, 1, 60</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root man-, ma-, to measure; Sanscr. ma, measure, moon; cf. Germ. Mond, moon, and O. H. Germ. mund, hand; Angl.-Sax. mund</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a hand.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27977.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam vero aptas, quamque multarum artium ministras manus natura homini dedit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas in manus sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurum in manus sumere, i. e. scripta Epicuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyxidem in manu tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum porrigere ad tradendum aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de manibus deponere,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay out of one's hands, lay down</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>. ponere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extorquere,</quote> <trans><tr>to wrest from one's hands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e manibus dimittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to let go out of one's hands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 30, 105</bibl></cit>: manum ad os apponere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to lay the finger on the lips</hi> in token of secrecy, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl>: alicui in manu esse, <hi rend="ital">to be obvious, clear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque mihi in manu Jugurtha qualis foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(feminas) in manu esse parentium, fratrum, virorum,</quote> <trans><tr>subject to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <cb n="MANU" /> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">minus filiae uxores sorores quibusdam in manu erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: in manibus esse, <hi rend="ital">to be in everybody's hands, to be well known</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est in manibus oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est in manibus laudatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 33, 125</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">to be near</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes sunt in manibus,</quote> <trans><tr>near to us, close by us, upon us</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19, 7</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">to be present</hi>: attendere, quae in manibus sunt, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 280</bibl>: in manibus habere, <hi rend="ital">to have in hand, to be engaged on</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quae in manibus habebam, abjeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeo opus magnum in manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi quamcunque rem habent in manibus, in eam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 27, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites bellum illud, quod erat in manibus, reliquisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum occasio in manibus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 36, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicorum in manibus mortuus est,</quote> <trans><tr>among</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:55:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 55, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu tenere,</quote> <trans><tr>to know for certain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:277" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 80, 277</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus teneri,</quote> <trans><tr>to be certain, evident</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:32:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 32, 69</bibl></cit>: habere in manibus, <hi rend="ital">to fondle, caress, make much of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic in manibus (inimicum meum) habebant, sic fovebant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in manus venire,</quote> <trans><tr>to come to hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl></cit>, b, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium in manibus facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to fight at close quarters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 57:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 57, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad manum habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to have at hand, have in readiness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad manum esse,</quote> <trans><tr>at hand, in hand, near</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19</bibl></cit>: ad manum venire or accedere, <hi rend="ital">to come hand to hand, come to close quarters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnumquam etiam res ad manus, atque ad pugnam veniebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut venere in manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ventum in manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adire manum alicui, v. 1. adeo: ad manum intueri aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>at hand, close by, hard by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae manu or manibus,</quote> <trans><tr>at hand, in readiness, in hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 180, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem servum ille habuit ad manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:60:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 60, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus a manu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a scribe, secretary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de manu dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to give with one's own hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 37</bibl></cit>: de manu in manum quippiam tradere, <hi rend="ital">to deliver from hand to hand</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with great care</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 2</bibl>: manum ferulae subducere, <hi rend="ital">to take the hand from the rod</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be too old for the rod</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 15</bibl>: e manu (for eminus; opp. cominus), <hi rend="ital">from a distance</hi>: quae mea cominus machaera atque hasta hostibit e manu, Enn. ap. Fest. s. v. redhostire, p. 270 Müll. (Trag. v. 212 Vahl.): plenā manu, <hi rend="ital">with a full</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plentiful hand, bountifully, liberally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenā manu dare,</quote> <trans><tr>abundantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 120:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 120, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Polyb. 9:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Polyb. 9, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so trop.: Hortalus, quam plenā manu nostras laudes in astra sustulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">plenis manibus pecuniam largiri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 16, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quemquam vacuis a se manibus abire pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 14:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: manibus pedibusque aliquid facere (Greek <foreign lang="greek">pu\c kai\ la/c</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">with hands and feet</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with all one's power, with might and main</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per manus,</quote> <trans><tr>with the hands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per manus servulae,</quote> <trans><tr>by her assistance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: per manus tradere, <hi rend="ital">to deliver from hand to hand, from mouth to mouth, to hand down from father to son</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">traditae per manus religiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 51</bibl></cit>: per manus, also, <hi rend="ital">by force, by main force, forcibly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per manus libertatem retinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 22</bibl></cit>: inter manus, <hi rend="ital">in one's hands, under one's hands</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agger inter manus proferebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa crescit inter manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil adhuc inter manus habui cui majorem sollicitudinem praestare deberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta quae inter manus habes,</quote> <trans><tr>are occupied with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">palpable, evident</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante oculos interque manus sunt omnia vestras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 311</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manus inter parentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 681</bibl></cit>: inter manus, also, <hi rend="ital">in one's hands, in one's arms</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abripite hunc intro actutum inter manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e convivio auferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: sub manu and sub manum, <hi rend="ital">at hand, near, readily, immediately, on the instant</hi>: Vocontii sub manu ut essent, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo celerius, ac sub manum annuntiari cognoscique posset, quid in provincia quāque gereretur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 1</bibl>: sub manus succedere, <hi rend="ital">according to one's wish</hi>, <pb n="1112" /> <cb n="MANU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 59</bibl>: alicujus manu esse, <hi rend="ital">to be from</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by one's hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae quae quidem erant tua manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 13, 1</bibl> (cf. II. C. infra): manu, <hi rend="ital">with the hand, by hand</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">artificially</hi>, opp. to naturally, by nature: manu sata, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by the hand of man</hi>, opp. to what grows wild. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs manu munitissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam ingenia manu, quod aiunt, facienda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 52:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam et liberos ejurent et orbitatem manu faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Marc. 19:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Marc. 19, 2</bibl></cit>: morbi, quos manu fecimus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">which we produce by our own fault</hi> (e. g. by intemperance), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev.
