Vit. 3, 3</bibl>: oratio manu facta, <hi rend="ital">artificial, elaborate</hi>, opp. to natural, simple, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 115, 2</bibl>: manu mederi, <hi rend="ital">to be a surgeon</hi>, Cels. praef. 1: manibus aequis or manu aequā, <hi rend="ital">with equal advantage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus aequis abscessum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequā manu discedere,</quote> <trans><tr>to come off with equal advantage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 4</bibl></cit>: manus afferre, <hi rend="ital">to lay hands on;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui diutius torqueri patitur, quem protinus potest liberare, beneficio suo manus affert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:5:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum inicere alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay the hand on one, to detain, arrest him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 48</bibl></cit>: manum dare, <hi rend="ital">to give</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lend a hand, to help, assist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl>: manus dare or dedere, <hi rend="ital">to give the hands</hi> to be bound; hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to give up, yield, surrender</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpende, et, si tibi vera videntur, Dede manus, aut, si falsum est, accingere contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1043" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1043</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateor, manus vobis do,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donicum aut certe vicissent, aut victi manum dedissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 260</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 568</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi manu,</quote> <trans><tr>immediately, without delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:43:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 43, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longā manu,</quote> <trans><tr>slowly, tediously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:79" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: manum tollere, <hi rend="ital">to raise the hand</hi> in token of an intention to yield, <hi rend="ital">to yield, submit</hi>: cedo et tollo manum, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 28</bibl>: manus tollere, <hi rend="ital">to raise the hands</hi> in token of admiration or astonishment, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 63</bibl>: manus tendere ad aliquem, less freq. alicui, <hi rend="ital">to stretch out the hands to one</hi> to implore assistance, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 17, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae Romanis manus tendebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextram Italiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu sternere aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>with the sword</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 702</bibl></cit>: utrāque manu, <hi rend="ital">with both hands</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">willingly, readily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:16:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 16, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus manum lavat,</quote> <trans><tr>one hand washes the other, one helps the other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Petr. c. 45, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 80</bibl>: manum non vertere, <hi rend="ital">not to turn the hand</hi>, prov. for <hi rend="ital">to take no pains, make no effort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se fatentur virtutis causā ne manum quidem versuros fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:31:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 31, 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 311</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n27977.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27977.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The hand as the instrument used in fight;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">personal valor, bravery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne usu manuque reliquorum opinionem fallent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu fortissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu fortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu vincere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu capere urbes,</quote> <trans><tr>by force of arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum committere Teucris,</quote> <trans><tr>to fight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 60</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">conserere manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:33" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferre manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 345</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proelia Ferre manum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 403</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et vice teli saevit nuda manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 54</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27977.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Force, violence, fighting, close combat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res venit ad manus atque ad pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire ad manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedere ad manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in manus venire,</quote> <trans><tr>to come to an engagement, come to close quarters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna jam ad manus venerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non manu, neque vi,</quote> <trans><tr>force, violence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 18</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27977.5" n="B" level="2"> Of the hand of an artist: <cit><quote lang="la">manus extrema non accessit ejus operibus,</quote> <trans><tr>the last hand, the finishing touch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 33, 126</bibl></cit>: aptius a summā conspiciare manu, <hi rend="ital">when you have given yourself the finishing touch</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">have completed your toilet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 225</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen nondum recepit ultimam manum,</quote> <trans><tr>has not yet received the last polish</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 118</bibl></cit>.—Hence, extremam bello Imponere manum, <hi rend="ital">to put the finishing hand to the war, to bring it to a close</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 573</bibl>.—Prov.: manum de tabula, lit., <hi rend="ital">the hand from the picture</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">enough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 25, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27977.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hand, handwriting;</hi> in gen., <hi rend="ital">work, workmanship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">librarii manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: Alexidis manum amabam, <cb n="MAPA" /> quod tam prope accedebat ad similitudinem tuae litterae, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum suam cognovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter emissam ab eis manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Praxitelis manus, Scopaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:39:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 39, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 455</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27977.7" n="D" level="2"> For pars, <hi rend="ital">a side</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est ad hanc manum sacellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a laeva conspicienda manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 307</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27977.8" n="E" level="2"> In throwing dice, <hi rend="ital">a stake</hi>: quas manus remisi, <hi rend="ital">to throw up the stakes</hi>, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27977.9" n="F" level="1"> In fencing, <hi rend="ital">a thrust, hit, blow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectae, aversae, tectaeque manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima, secunda, tertia, quarta,</quote> <trans><tr>the prime, second, tierce, quart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27977.10" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The trunk</hi> of an elephant: <cit><quote lang="la">manus etiam data elephantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:628" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 628</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27977.11" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The fore-paws</hi> of bears, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27977.12" n="K" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The branches</hi> on a tree: <cit><quote lang="la">(platanus) cui lnnumerae manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:3:39" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraxineae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Insit. 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27977.13" n="L" level="1"> In milit. lang.: ferreae manus, <hi rend="ital">iron hooks with which an enemy's ship was grappled, grappling-irons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus ferreas atque harpagones paraverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in advenientes hostium naves ferreas manus inicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus ferreas excogitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3:24" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 38" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 635</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27977.14" n="M" level="1"> Also milit., <hi rend="ital">an armed force, corps</hi> of soldiers: <cit><quote lang="la">si nova manus cum veteribus copiis se conjunxisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam manum conducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hasdrubalem propediem affore cum manu haudquaquam contemnenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 27</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n27977.15" n="2" level="3"> Beyond the milit. sphere, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a body, host, number, company, multitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam veniet cum magna manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evocatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus ad Quirinalia paratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manum facere, copias parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:5:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaeorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 28, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bicorpor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Centaurs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpuratorum et satellitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna clientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:262" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27977.16" n="N" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Labor, hands</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">workmen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos aera, manus, navalia demus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale manus addunt ebori decus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 592</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27977.17" n="O" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Power</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec non sunt in nostra manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: in tua manu est, <hi rend="ital">it rests with you</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta deos in tua manu positum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria in manu nobis est,</quote> <trans><tr>depends on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vostra manu situm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in manu esse mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 67</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27977.18" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">the legal power of a husband over his wife, the manus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in potestate quidem et masculi et feminae esse solent: in manum autem feminae tantum conveniunt. Olim itaque tribus modis in manum conveniebant: usu, farreo, coëmptione, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:108 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 108 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 34, 84 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n27977.19" n="P" level="1"> Law t. t., manūs injectio, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an arrest</hi>: per manus injectionem agebatur, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 21</bibl>: ob eam rem ego tibi sestertium X. milium judicati manus inicio, Vet. Form. ap. Gai. ib.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27978" type="gloss" key="ma_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mānus</orth>, i. q. bonus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 5, 30, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 139</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 286</bibl>; v. ‡ cerus manus.</entryFree>
manutergium: <entryFree id="n27979" type="gloss" key="ma^nu^tergi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭtergĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. manustergeo</etym>, <sense id="n27979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a towel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manutergium a tergendo manus vocatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manutigium: <entryFree id="n27980" type="main" key="ma^nu^ti^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mănŭtĭgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. manus-tango</etym>, <sense id="n27980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a touching</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeling with the hand</hi> ( = manuum contactus; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:18:177" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 18, 177</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">post-class.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:121" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
manzer: <entryFree id="n27981" type="foreign" key="manzer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">manzer</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mamzer</orth>), <itype>ĕris</itype>, <sense id="n27981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. comm.</hi> [Heb. <foreign />], <hi rend="ital">illegitimate, bastard</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Carm. 5, 256</bibl>: agmina manzera, Ven. Carm. 5, 5, 75.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">manzer</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a bastard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ingredietur manzer, hoc est de scorto natus, in Ecclesiam Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 23, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mapalia: <entryFree id="n27982" type="foreign" key="ma^pa_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măpālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Punic</etym>, <sense id="n27982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">huts, cottages</hi> of the Africans: mapalia casae Punicae appellantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=146:25" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 146, 25</bibl> Müll.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=147" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 147</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia Numidarum agrestium, quae mapalia illi vocant, oblonga, incurvis lateribus tecta, quasi navium carinae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex oppidis et mapalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 46, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mapalibus pecoribusque suis persecuti sunt regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et raris habitata mapalia tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 340</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:89" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 20</bibl>, <cb n="MARC" /> 8.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. Odyss. 16</bibl>.—Collect. coït e sparso concita mapali Agrestum manus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:460" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 460</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27982.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27982.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A house of ill-repute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:58:13" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 58, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27982.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Useless things, follies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 9:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mappa: <entryFree id="n27983" type="main" key="mappa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mappa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Punic, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 57</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n27983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a napkin, table-napkin; a towel</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27983.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varius mappa compescere risum Vix poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laticlavia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:46:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 46, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubra detergere vulnera mappa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:27" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27983.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cloth</hi> with which the signal for starting was given to racers in the circus, <hi rend="ital">a signalcloth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mappam usitatum Circo nomen, Poeni sibi vindicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mappa cretata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:29:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Megalesiacae spectacula mappae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:191" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo liberto mittente mappam, unde magistratus solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mappula: <entryFree id="n27984" type="main" key="mappu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mappŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mappa</etym>, <sense id="n27984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small napkin</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mappulam apponere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108, 28</bibl></cit> (al. matulam).</sense></entryFree>
maracanda: <entryFree id="n27985" type="main" key="Maracanda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maracanda</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital of Sogdiana</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Samarcand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:9:20" default="NO">7, 9, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marathenus: <entryFree id="n27986" type="main" key="Ma^ra^the_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărăthēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Marathos, II.</entryFree>
marathon: <entryFree id="n27987" type="main" key="Ma^ra^thon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărăthon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*maraqw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n27987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Vrana</hi>) <hi rend="ital">on the eastern coast of Attica, famed for the death of Icarus, the victory of Theseus over the Marathonian bull, and that of Miltiades over the Persians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:18" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 15, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium apud Marathona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 433</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27987.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărătho-nĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maraqw/nios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Marathon, Marathonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an etiam Theseus Marathonii tauri cornua comprehendit iratus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:22:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27987.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Athenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marathonia virgo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Erigone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:74" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:650" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 650</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5" default="NO">5</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n27987.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărăthōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maraqwni/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Marathonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercum Marathonida Theseus extulit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the spear with which he fought against the Marathonian bull</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:730" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marathonide silvā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 644</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marathos: <entryFree id="n27988" type="main" key="Ma^ra^thos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărăthos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ma/raqos</foreign>, <sense id="n27988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient Phœnician city, opposite the island of Arados</hi>, near the modern <hi rend="ital">Ainel-Hye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 20, 17, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 6</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărăthēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Marathos, Marathene</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Menelaüs,</quote> <trans><tr>a rhetorician from Marathos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 26, 100</bibl></cit> Meyer.</sense></entryFree>
marathrites: <entryFree id="n27989" type="greek" key="ma^ra^thri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mărăthrītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">maraqri/ths</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">oi)=nos</foreign>), <sense id="n27989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine flavored with fennel, fennelwine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum absinthiten, et hyssopiten, et marathriten sic condire oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:35" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 35 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
marathrus: <entryFree id="n27990" type="greek" key="ma^ra^thrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mărăthrus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mără-thrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/raqron</foreign>, <sense id="n27990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fennel</hi>, called in pure Lat. feniculum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">marathros (v. l. marathrus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 91</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marathus: <entryFree id="n27991" type="main" key="Ma^ra^thus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărăthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ma/raqos</foreign>. <sense id="n27991.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A favorite of Tibullus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27991.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A freedman who wrote the acts of Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n27992" type="main" key="Ma^ra^thus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărăthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Marathos.</entryFree>
marcellus: <entryFree id="n27993" type="main" key="Marcellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><lbl>dim.</lbl> of Marcus</etym>, <sense id="n27993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman family name in the plebeian</hi> gens Claudia: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Marcellos et Claudios patricios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generosior Marcellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:145" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27993.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., M. Claudius Marcellus, <hi rend="ital">the taker of Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:855" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 855</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 46</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Another M. Claudius Marcellus,</quote> <trans><tr>the nephew of Octavian and adopted by him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:93" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 18</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:861 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 861 sq.</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Marc. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Marc. 2, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n27993.2" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n27993.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcellīa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ēa</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a festival in honor of the Marcelli in Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21, § 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 63, § 154</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27993.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcellĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Marcellus, Marcellian</hi>: theatrum, <hi rend="ital">named after</hi> M. Claudius Marcellus, <hi rend="ital">the nephew of Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marcens: <entryFree id="n27994" type="main" key="marcens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. marceo, <sense id="n27994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
marceo: <entryFree id="n27995" type="main" key="marce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root mar, die; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">marai/nw, marasmo/s</foreign>; cf. also morbus, morior</etym>, <sense id="n27995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wither, droop, shrink, shrivel</hi> </sense><sense id="n27995.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): marcebant coronae,<pb n="1113" /> <cb n="MARC" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 244</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva comis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:29" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27995.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be faint, weak, drooping, feeble, languid, lazy</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">annis corpus jam marcet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:946" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 946</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marcent luxuria, vino, et epulis per totam hiemem confecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otio ac desidia corrupti marcebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:84" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si marcet animus, si corpus torpet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Seren. 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 1, 60</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">marcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., withering, drooping, feeble, wasted away, exhausted, weak, languid, indolent</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n27995.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">marcentes coronae, Claud. Epithal. Pall. et Celer. 96: marcentes tibi porrigentur uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:78:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 78, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia marcentia vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:428" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 428</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27995.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:630" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 630</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex marcentibus annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:746" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 746</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 788" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 788</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 704</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tostis marcentem squillis recreabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vitellius deses et marcens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>enfeebling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:56" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 36</bibl></cit>: flamma cupiditatis, Mam. <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Act. ad Julian. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marcesco: <entryFree id="n27996" type="main" key="marcesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marcesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n27996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [marceo], <hi rend="ital">to wither, pine away, droop, decay</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n27996.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fagus et cerrus celeriter marcescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 79, § 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae spectatissime florent, celerrime marcescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 19, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27996.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become weak, feeble, powerless, to pine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">waste away, languish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marcescens celerius nominis sui flore,</quote> <trans><tr>fading</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 41, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia genera pecorum morbo et languoribus marcescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senio vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 38, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitem marcescere desidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 35, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marcescere otii situ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 45, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 35, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otia per somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:61" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 9, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jac. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marcia: <entryFree id="n27997" type="main" key="Marci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭa ăqua</orth>, v. Marcius, A.</entryFree>
marcianopolis: <entryFree id="n27998" type="main" key="Marci^a_no^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭānŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*markianou/polis</foreign>, <sense id="n27998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Lower Mœsia on the Euxine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Imertje</hi>, Treb. Poll. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marcianus: <entryFree id="n27999" type="main" key="Marci^a_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Marcius, B. and 2. Marcus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28000" type="main" key="Marci^a_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <sense id="n28000.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Tullius M.,</quote> <trans><tr>a freedman and steward of Cicero</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n28001" type="main" key="Marci^a_nus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Martianus.</entryFree>
marcidat: <entryFree id="n28002" type="gloss" key="marci^dat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marcĭdat</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">th/kei, th:ketai</foreign>, <sense id="n28002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">melts away</hi>, Gloss. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
marcidulus: <entryFree id="n28003" type="main" key="marci^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marcĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n28003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [marcidus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat drooping, somewhat faint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">languid</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">marcidulis luminibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 727</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marcidus: <entryFree id="n28004" type="main" key="marci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>marceo</etym>, <sense id="n28004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">withered, wasted, shrunk, decayed, rotten</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n28004.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilia marcida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 50, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatrices, id. prooem. 23: stagna,</quote> <trans><tr>foul</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asseres vetustate marcidi fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 6</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n28004.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">weak, feeble, languid, enervated, exhausted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc incede gradu marcidus ebrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 69" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marcidus edomito bellum referebat ab Haemo Liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:652" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:63" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno aut libidinosis vigiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:63" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 63</bibl>: sol, <hi rend="ital">faint, pale, dull</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 445</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:7:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi libidine marcidi,</quote> <trans><tr>languishing, voluptuous</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 135, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marcion: <entryFree id="n28005" type="main" key="Marci^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcīon</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 120</bibl>), <sense id="n28005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heretic of Sinope, who gave himself out to be Christ</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Praescr. adv. Haeret. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 502</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28005.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭōnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the heretic Marcion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">continentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. Haeret. 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28005.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭō-nista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a follower of the heretic Marcion, a Marcionite.—Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28005.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭōnīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for Marcionensis, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the heretic Marcion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marcionita Deus, tristis, ferus insidiator,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>feigned by Marcion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 129</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭōnītae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">Marcionites, disciples of Marcion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. Her. 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 30, 10</bibl>; Ambros. de Fide, 5, 13, 162.—</sense><sense id="n28005.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A native of Smyrna, the author of a treatise</hi> De simplicibus effectibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 38</bibl>. <cb n="MARC" /></sense></entryFree>
marcipor: <entryFree id="n28006" type="main" key="Marci^por"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭpor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. e. Marci puer, <sense id="n28006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the slave of Marcus.—Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 26</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. quintipor, p. 257, 19 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n28006.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The title of a satire of Varro</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
marcius: <entryFree id="n28007" type="main" key="Marci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n28007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n28007.1" n="1" level="3"> Ancus Marcius, <hi rend="ital">the fourth king of Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:18:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 18, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 35</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">L. Marcius,</quote> <trans><tr>a Roman knight, who commanded the army in Spain after the death of the Scipios</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 37 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n28007.2" n="2" level="3"> Two brothers Marcii, <hi rend="ital">Roman soothsayers in very ancient times</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 40, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 50, 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 55, 113</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭa</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a vestal virgin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Mil. p. 46" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Mil. p. 46</bibl> Orell.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28007.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Marcius, Marcian</hi>: Marcia aqua, <hi rend="ital">brought into Rome first by king</hi> Ancus Marcius, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards by the prætor</hi> Q. Marcius Rex, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 24, § 41</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also: Marcius liquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:52" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:22:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 22, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lympha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:58" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 58</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">frigora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:25" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: Marcius saltus, <hi rend="ital">in Liguria, where the consul</hi> Q. Marcius <hi rend="ital">suffered a defeat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28007.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Marcius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <trans><tr>of the soothsayer Marcius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12</bibl></cit>: foedus, <hi rend="ital">made by</hi> L. Marcius <hi rend="ital">with the inhabitants of Gades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 17, 39</bibl>.—Silva Marciana, <hi rend="ital">a mountain-range in western Germany, the Schwarzwald</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 8, 2</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭānē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of Marcius</hi>, Prisc. vol. 2, p. 528, 25 Hertz.</sense></entryFree>
marcodurum: <entryFree id="n28008" type="main" key="Marco^du_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcŏdūrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n28008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Ubians, in the west of Germany</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Düren</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marcolica: <entryFree id="n28009" type="main" key="Marco^li^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcŏlĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief city of Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
marcomani: <entryFree id="n28010" type="main" key="Marco^ma^ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcŏmăni</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-manni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>marka, a march, border; the marchmen, borderers</etym>, <sense id="n28010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Germanic people, a portion of the tribe of the Suevi, who, after their defeat by Drusus, removed from the Rhine and the Main to the country of the Boii</hi> (Bohemians), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:108" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:109" default="NO">109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:110" default="NO">110</bibl> and 382; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:170" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 170</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 13, 3</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n28010.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcŏmănĭa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-mannĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Marcomanni</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 24, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28010.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcŏmănĭcus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-mannĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Marcomanni, Marcomannic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl>: MARCOMANNICVS MAXIMVS, <hi rend="ital">a surname given to Caracalla, commemorative of his victory over the Marcomanni</hi>, Inscr. Mur. 1021, 7.</sense></entryFree>
marcor: <entryFree id="n28011" type="main" key="marcor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marcor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>marceo</etym>, <sense id="n28011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a withering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:27:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 27, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28011.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Decay, rottenness</hi> (not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">panni marcor,</quote> <trans><tr>a rotten rag</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 46, § 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28011.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Faintness, languor, indolence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marcor, et inexpugnabilis dormiendi necessitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernitis expositas turpi marcore cohortes, i. e. somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:269" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maeror marcorque,</quote> <trans><tr>melancholy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 2:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducis,</quote> <trans><tr>indolence, worthlessness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:119:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 119, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marculentus: <entryFree id="n28012" type="main" key="marcu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marcŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>marcor</etym>, <sense id="n28012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">withered, feeble, faint</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">marculenta foliorum calvities,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marculus: <entryFree id="n28013" type="main" key="marcu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marcŭlus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">martŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>marcus</etym>, <sense id="n28013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small hammer, a hammer</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">malleus vocatur, quia dum quid calet et molle est, caedit et producit: marcus, malleus major: et dictus marcus, quod major sit ad caedendum, et fortior: marcellus mediocris: marculus malleus pusillus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Lucil. ib.: tegulas invenit Cinyra, et metalla aeris, item forcipem, martulum, vectem, incudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii caelo et marculo gemmulas exsculpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Caes. 4:4:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Caes. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit> Mai.: <cit><quote lang="la">aerariorum marculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:57:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 57, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28014" type="main" key="Marcu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcŭlus</orth> <itype>diminutivum a Marco</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=125" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 125</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
marcus: <entryFree id="n28015" type="main" key="marcus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">marcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. mar, mrid, to break, crush</etym>, <sense id="n28015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large hammer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 7, 2, v. 1</bibl>. marculus.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n28016" type="main" key="Marcus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman prænomen</hi>, in gen. represented by M. simply, e. g. M. Terentius Varro, M. Tullius Cicero; <cit><quote lang="la">written in full, MAARCVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Rein.</author> 1006</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">MARCVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 324, 450</bibl></cit>; p. 342, 528 et saep. Afterwards also <hi rend="ital">a surname</hi>, e. g. C. PONTIVS C. L. MARCVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 986, 5</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Marcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <cb n="MARE" /> <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Marcus, Marcian</hi>: sodales, <hi rend="ital">the priests who performed the sacred rites instituted in honor of the emperor</hi> Marcus Aurelius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pertinax, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sever. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 379</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mardi: <entryFree id="n28017" type="main" key="Mardi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mardi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n28017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plundering race dwelling in the highlands between Media, Susiana, and Persis, near the Hyrcanians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 5, 5, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 16, 18, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:17" default="NO">5, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:11" default="NO">6, 5, 11</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">natione Mardus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mardonius: <entryFree id="n28018" type="main" key="Mardo^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mardŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mardo/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n28018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son-in-law of Darius, and general of the Persians, defeated by Pausanias at Platæa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mare: <entryFree id="n28019" type="main" key="ma^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măre</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n28019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> mare, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 45</bibl> and 111 P.; and in <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 759</bibl> ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 6, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">198</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 21, 11</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> marum, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 770</bibl> P.), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root mar-, gleam, glimmer (cf. <foreign lang="greek">a(/ls marmare/h</foreign>, Il. 14, 273); Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ma/rmaros</foreign>; Lat. marmor; Sanscr. mīras, sea; Goth. marei; Angl. - Sax. mere; Germ. Meer. Curtius, however, refers these words to root mar-, die; cf. morior, marceo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi>, opp. to dry land. </sense><sense id="n28019.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n28019.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: sol, qui Mare, terram, caelum contines tuo cum lumine, Enn. ap. Prob. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl> (Trag. v. 322 Vahl.): indu mari magno, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 425 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">mare infidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctuosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultuosum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 671</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastum atque apertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundum et immensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ingressus es mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare pedibus ingredi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 15, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remenso ire mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 144</bibl></cit>: terrā marique, <hi rend="ital">by sea and by land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra marique acquirenda,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at all hazards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:222" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 222</bibl></cit>; v. terra.—In <number>plur.</number>: maria salsa, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 183, 18</bibl> (Trag. v. 145 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus cavernis maria sustineantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in reliquis maribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> as a figure for hard-heartedness: <cit><quote lang="la">te saevae progenuere ferae Aut mare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 155</bibl>; cf. also: Nam mare haud est mare; vos mare acerrumum; <cit><quote lang="la">nam in mari repperi, hic elavi bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 8 sq.</bibl></cit>: meretricem ego item esse reor mare ut est; <cit><quote lang="la">quod des devorat, numquam abundat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:17 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 17 sq.</bibl></cit>—In apposition with Oceanus: <cit><quote lang="la">proximus mare Oceanum in Andibus hiemarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: ecce maris magna claudit nos obice pontus,</quote> <trans><tr>the depths of the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maria omnia caelo Miscere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 790</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: mare caelo miscere, <hi rend="ital">to mingle sea and sky</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to raise a terrific storm, bluster</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clames licet, et mare caelo Confundas, homo sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:282" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis caelum terris non misceat et mare caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit>: terrā marique aliquid quaerere or conquirere, <hi rend="ital">to search for a thing by sea and land</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">everywhere</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 105</bibl>; Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13</bibl>: maria et montes polliceri, <hi rend="ital">to promise seas and mountains</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">more than one can perform</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 2</bibl>: his qui contentus non est, in mare fundat aquas, <hi rend="ital">pour water into the sea</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">fill that which is already full</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n28019.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of single seas: <cit><quote lang="la">mare nostrum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Mediterranean Sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 30, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 293</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare superum,</quote> <trans><tr>the Upper Sea, the Adriatic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:5:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 5, 10 al.</bibl>: mare inferum, <hi rend="ital">the Etruscan Sea</hi>, Cic. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:8:3:5" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 8, 3, 5</bibl>; Mel. l. l.; <cit><quote lang="la">Plin. l. l. al.: mare Aegeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:246" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 246</bibl></cit>: mare rubrum, v. ruber; <cit><quote lang="la">of a fresh - water lake: Galileae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 4, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28019.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n28019.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sea-water, salt-water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chium maris expers,</quote> <trans><tr>unmixed Chian wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 15</bibl></cit> (id est, sine aqua marina, Schol. Acr.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">vinum mari condire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28019.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The color of the sea, sea-green</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi virens mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 21, § 80</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n28019.7" n="C" level="2"> Of the air: mare aëris, <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">expanse of air</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id omne Aëris in magnum fertur mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 276</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28019.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A large vessel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bases et mare aëneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 25, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
marea: <entryFree id="n28020" type="main" key="Ma^re^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărĕa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărĕōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n28020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake</hi> <pb n="1114" /> <cb n="MARG" /> <hi rend="ital">and city of Lower Egypt, not far from Alexandria</hi> (called in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*mare/a</foreign>), Edict. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9" default="NO">9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17" default="NO">17</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n28020.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n28020.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărĕō-tĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Mareotic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vinum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <hi rend="ital">Egyptian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 733</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cortex,</quote> <trans><tr>the papyrus plant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:209" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <trans><tr>the Egyptian pyramids</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:36:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbiter,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Busiris</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:103" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n28020.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărĕ-ōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*marew=tis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Mareotic</hi>: Mareotis Libya, <hi rend="ital">a part of Libya bordering on Egypt, whose inhabitants are called</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mă-rĕōtae</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">*marew=tai</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 6, 6, § 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Mareotic lake, Lake Mareotis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 62</bibl></cit>; or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mărĕōtis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 354</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis, i. e. navis Alexandrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:103" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
